text: Kind of a strong nut brown ale with some licorice molasses raisins. I would have preferred it without those last flavors but thats the way it goes.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Thanks for the bottle Helen!
Poured into a mug, the appearance was a muddy brown color with a finger and a halfs worth of sly tan foamy head. Milky lace.
The aroma had the normal Nogne initial smell - coca cola followed but some hazelnuts, light milk and dark chocolate. Subtle grassy hops.
The flavor was exceptionally sweet, that coca cola taste didnt meld enough with the hazelnuts. The malt had some roastiness to it. Aftertaste was coca cola and hazelnut with a clean sweet finish.
The feel was semi-cloying as the coca cola flavor produced a slick semi-oily texture. Carbonation felt fine. ABV felt fine.
Overall, Nogne does something to their beers that I dont know what it is, that coca cola syrupy thing just seems to not do it for me so much.
Bottle.Muddy brown colour with medium head.Aroma is roasted and malty with hint of hazelnuts and dried fruits,flavor of caramel and hops,oily texture and slight bready finish.
Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours murky Brown. Nuts, chocolate, hazelnut with wood, pine finish. A little medicinal on end.
0,5 l. Bottle. Dark brown head with creamy head. Roasted malt and fruit aroma. Moderate sweet, hoppy, roasted, fig flavor. Full body. Bitter finish.

Ambrée sombre et trouble, collet epais de fines bulles
Aromes tres marqués sur le caramel, fruits secs et une pointe de chocolat
Cremeuse, bonne dose de malt torrefie qui fait place au houblon progressivement.
Amertume moderee.
Hummm
Bottle (500 ml) @ Copenhagen Airport 20170214. Roasted and hoppy, caramely, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is roasted and hoppy.

500 ml bottle,
very dark redbrown with off white rather creamy head.
dried fruits (apple, prune, date, raisin), molasses. taste is similar with more roasty notes.
full to medium body, creamy texture and soft crbonisation.

50 cl bottle @ home. Clear dark brown color. Beige head with reasonable retention. Aromas: roasted malts, light sweet and fruit, light skunky hops. Retronasal its malty sweet, roasted, hops. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasted, drop/licorice. Medium bodied. Finish is roasted, moderate bitter. Pretty nice, especially for a brown ale.

Aroma is semi-sweet malty with dark malt, caramel, prune and dried fig. Taste is semi-sweet malty with dark malt, caramel, dried fruits like prune and fig. Finish is light dry and complex malty.

50 cl, bottle conditioned, batch #1522. Dark, ruby red-brown, medium tan head, medium to low carbonation. Aroma of dark fruits, a bit nutty and caramelly notes from the malts. Mouthfeel is silky smooth. Flavour is crammed with dark malts, dark fruits and a hoppy bite, long aftertaste, slight hints of alcohol.

Bottle (1pt 0.9 oz). Pours slightly hazy dark brown with light tan head. Nose of plums, caramel, and brown sugar with a hint of alcohol. Some plum and caramel notes with brown sugar following. A hint of chocolate with subtle alcohol in the finish. Chewy mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from beerhawk. Brown beer with small head. Aroma is malty, nutty and caramel. Taste is nutty, malts, dry, some red leaf and chestnuts. Light to medium bodied. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle thanks to sarky northner for xmas cheers Martin. Cloudy brown decent head. Nice malty spice nutty aroma taste same some fruit nice seeetness with a good hoppy finish. Nice mouthfeel. Very good.

Handgun. Hazy brown color. Sweet caramel and candy aroma alongside mildly earthy hops. Tastes like toasted malt and toffee, overall on the sweeter side. Light carbonation, light to medium mouthfeel. Good, but not spectacular.

Nagy, tartós, bézs hab, sötétbarna szín. Karamelles, malátás illat. Karamelles, pörkölt malátás, aszalt gyümölcsös ízvilág, kissé száraz lecsengéssel. Közepesen testes és kesernyés, közepesen szénsavas. Csodás, kifinomult sör, nagyon jó összhanggal és kiváló egyensúllyal.

Keg@ Malte, Coruña. 09-02-2015.
A dark brown ale, topped with a nice off white head. Quite roasty and spicy, dry roasted taste, Robust. Enjoyable.
Bottle at Bierhof Athens. Murky brown with tan head. Alcoholic, a little bit of hazelnut. Very alcoholic, a little malty underneath and bitter. Full body, very carbd and boozy finish.
Tap at Churchkey. Murky brownish orange pour, minor head. Herbal hop aroma. Caramel malt taste with a minor but pleasant little hop kick.

Copenhagen 27/11 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. Brown "Ø" on the label (does not seem to wear any clothes). Pours slightly hazy dark brown til a red tinge. Creamy off-white head. Settles as fine 0,5 cm thick creamy layer of foam. Lacing on the side of the glass. Strong aroma of roasted dark malts, caramel, wood and bitter coffee. A little alcohol lurking in the background. Soft carbonation and thick oily palate. Flavor is quite sweet and roasted but balanced by a quite pronounced coffee bitterness. Bitter aftertaste with some caramel. Lingering. A very fine and powerful Brown Ale. A pleasure to drink.

500ml bottle found by chance at Liquorland Tauranga.
Dark brown color with creamy head and good steady carbonation.
Aroma is rum and raisin, roasted malt, sherry cask and Christmas cake.
Mild bitterness with a full malt body and finish.
Nice.

Draft 0.25l at Thornbridge Bar S Hertogenbosch, The Netherlands. Taste with cika Boban, 07.09.2016. Pour it dark brown color with small white head. Aroma of milk chocolate and coffee. Taste starts with roasted malt, smooth creamy all the time, roasted coffee beans, some caramel on the back, pinch of bitter feel, medium to full body, bread, creamy to sticky texture, average carbonation, long finish. Nice!

From bottle at Copenhagen airport. Aroma is quite nice, with caramel and hazelnut, maybe some licorice. Pours dark copper with limited brownish foam. Body is medium-high with a nice carbonation feeling. Taste has a good sweet base given by malts, but bitterness is somehow superior in the mouth. Finish is dry enough, with some persistence of the bitterness. Nice beer!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
[9/25/16] Draught sample at Borefts After Festival 2016 in Rotterdam. Deep amber-brown. Aroma of caramel, hops, toast, nuts. Sweetish flavor with malt, caramel, nuts, toast, and bitter hops.
On tap. Brown colour with off-white head. Aroma malty and caramel. Taste sweet caramel malt and hoppy undertone.

Unclear nutbrown with light brown head. All I really think of in the aroma is rye bread and maybe some toffee sweetness. Really nice aroma though! Pleasant sweet taste with the bitterhops sneaking in and dominating the finish. Oh this is good stuff. A full bodied brown ale with lots of hops is really among my prefered beer styles at the moment. This is a great example of why I love the style.

Tap @Delirium Cafe in Brussels
Aroma of nuts, dark bread, caramel, green apples and a bit of solvent (faulty, not enough to fuck the beer up completely, but still it was annoying)
The malty side of the beer is good, but the faulty part was pretty bad.

Sampled from tap at Kaapse BAF 2016. Cloudy hazelnut brown. Light tan ring head. Sweet caramel, sugar cane, maple and nuttiness. Over medium sweet and mild bitter. Medium body, soft to average carbonation. Syruppy feel, bittersweet finish.
Brown / dark amber with medium beige head. Aroma with certain whisky notes. Strong bitterness with smoked whisky barrel notes m lasting bitter aftertaste.

On tap at Kaapse Brouwers, (Borefts After Festival 2016), Rotterdam. 
Nose is roasted malt, chocolate. 
Body is clear brown, head is small, beige, creamy, mostly diminishing, excellent lacing. 
Aroma is roasted peanuts, milk chocolate, brown sugar. 
Medium sweet, light bitter. 
Finish is medium lasting roasty medium bittersweet. 
Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. 
Easy dessertish beer, simple but tasty, nice one.
0,5l bottle from Firmabier. Pours deep brown colour with small head. Aroma of hoppiness, coffee, nuts, malts, caramel. Mediumish body, quite bitter aftertaste.

500 ml bottle. Pours a veiled mahogany brown with a short lived white head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, hazelnut, booze. Flavor is chocolate, caramel, booze. Finish is ash, burnt, hazelnut and chocolate. Medium to full body, light to average carbonation.

At Kufle i kapsle, Warsaw, February 2014. Shared with lovely Anja. Sample on a "deska piw" (beer plank for tasting). Dark red, orange tint, lasting white head and lacing. Roasty and smoky aroma, very heavy, like a Nutella. Tart, some dryness, balanced. Full taste, dusty, thick, some carbonation. Very rich beer, interesting aromas, flavors and texture.

500 ml bottle. Pours chestnut brown with a beige head. The first sniff is hoppy (citric fruits) then moderately malty. Breadish and some caramel. Medium to full body with a soft and very pleasant carbonation. The taste is sweet with some bitterness coming in towards the finish. Multiple flavours -roasted malts and honey with mild coffee in the ending. Very well balanced aromas and an excellent beer.

Un colore tonaca di frate piuttosto scuro, birra torbida con lievito sospeso. La. Schiuma è biancastra, compatta. Aroma dolce, caramellato, dark fruits. Anche la bevuta è dolce e maltata, con caramello, sentori di frutta secca. Birra intensa, dal corpo pieno, rotonda con alcol che accompagna benissimo, consistenza quasi oleosa. Carbonazione bassa. Veramente ottima.

Draught @ Kittys, Helsinki. (3,50 / 0,4l) . Pours deep brown with a thick white head. 
Bready, caramelly, hoppy aroma. Sweet caramelly, mild spicy, bready, hoppy flavors. Malty, full of flavors. Long finish. This. Is. Beer.

Tap @ basement beer bar, Aalborg. Aroma of caramel, some roasted malts, some dark dried fruits. Hazy brown with off-white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate sweet and light+ bitter. Full body, oily feel, caramel and bitter finish.

Aroma of nuts, chocolate, toffee, dark bread, toasty. 
Pours brown with a small off white head. 
Taste is medium sweet and lightly bitter. 
Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation and nice finish of toffee and chocolate. Easy drinking for its 7,5%. 
Quality brown ale.

DAA; Bottle 0,5L, from Vinmonopolet. Batch nr: 1573 A. Pours large, hazy cobber, with a creamy, forever lasting and lacing, light tan head. Nose is moderate, roasted malt, caramel, nuts and light dark fruit and coffe. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and bitter, balancing with a lasting dark dried fruit, warming, caramel finish. Body is medium to full, texture oily to creamy, carbonation is soft. Perfect apperance, delicious beer.
Pours murky brown with low off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, caramel, roasted malt. Taste is sweet, caramel and toffee, butterscotch finish. Medium bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.

Une brune sans filtre, mousse par une texture compacte et capitonnée. Un nez de grains légèrement grillés, de caramel, de malt et dépices. Saveurs grillées, à la limite du brûlé, poivrées et supportées par une forte effervescence où une touche herbacée rajoute quelque chose dintéressant. Elle est évolutive. Lamertume, elle, arrive sur le tard. Bien agréable à boire. (Batch 1522 Emb.18.10.15) (1795-110416)

Appearance- dark, mahogany, ruby hints, a small frothy beige head. Aroma- very nutty- pecan, almond, dates, dark malts, brown bread, hops, vanilla, raisin, treacle, toast. Taste- sticky dark malts, sweet treacle-glazed bread, pecan pie, honey, roasted toasted nuts, slightly burnt toast, undercurrents of dark fruits. Sweet finish. Really nice and well-crafted.

500 ml bottle. Clear dark brown color with strong creamy light brown head. Smells nice roast malts with some expresso coffee and hazelnuts. Taste are roast malts with sweetness and some coffee and hazelnuts notes inside and a little bitterness. Its warm up when u drink it because it has 7 % and you dont feel alcohol. Rich and long staing aftertaste nice roast malt sweetness with pleasant coffee and nuts biterrnes and dry finish

Clear deep brown color with strong medium cappuccino foam. Aromas of malt, nuts, caramel, light coffee, bit boozy and aged though on the sweeter side. Palate, full bodied with slightly oily thicish texture leaving nice warming, sweet malty finish. Taste is more on the sweet side, mainly of nut oil and nuts, caramel malts and has slight, but very light warming boozy feel but not too strong and overwhelming. Overall, very nice ale almost could say voluptuous, smooth and relaxing. If you see it give it a try!

0.5L bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours a very dark brown with a medium beige head and lacing. Aroma is rich and malty, fruits, caramel, hint of roastedness and alcohol. Taste is rich malts, sweet, fruity, mild woody/roast flavours, some alcohol and a bitter finish.
UPDATED: MAR 14, 2016 Mahogany pour with small silky head sherry infused fruitcake rich malts hint of roastiness. Sticky toffee pudding great stuff never knew brown ale could be so good.

Bottle, Batch Number 1426, bottled on 5/5/15. Thanks Alex @Ale House. Im surprised I havent rated it yet as Ive definitely drunk it before!

Poured into Tocalmatto pint glass. Big white lacing. Dark brown, red and caramel in colour. Aroma is wood fires, log cabin, Finish saunas, chestnut wood, marzipan, sugarcane and sock sweat. 

Taste is wood resin, blackcurrants, roasted chestnuts, Icelandic salt licorice sweets, raisins, cream and dark soy source. Its fairly bitter for the style and its pretty clean. Soft malts. Juicy. Good use of East Kent Goldings which are great for old ales. Would swap the Chinook for Bramling Cross though as it needs more blackcurrant. Nice rich beer which is good for a slow cold winter which were still experiencing in England. Come on Spring where are you?

Tap @ Hugos w senior. Appearance: pours clear red-brown with good creamy beige soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, caramel, nuts, wood, light alcohol, berries and herbal notes. palette: strong malty aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, medium sweetness, balanced by a medium to distinct bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: very delightful brown ale
Bottle at home. Pours deep brown, nose is caramel, roasted, little soapy, taste is sweet, chewy toffee, fruity.

Definitiv eins der besseren Brown Ales, vielleicht bedingt durch seinen recht hohen Alkoholgehalt, aber auch in der Ausgewogenheit durchaus annehmbar. Leicht schokoladig, dazu etwas Malz, ein paar Rosinen und Brot - prickelnd zum Schluss und angenehm süffig. Gute Sache.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep dark brown colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of malt, warm cookies and barrel. Taste of malt, mild coffee, light chocolate, cream, nuts, roast, woods and barrel. Very warming and tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, fruit, nuts and bread.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with heavy yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, fruit and nuts; ends slightly dry with bread.

Overall:

This beer is intense and balanced, but lacks complexity. Waited a year with drinking my second bottle and it surely gives it a rustic flavour. The aroma could have been stronger and the taste a bit more complex, but it is insanely good for its style.

Flasche gekauft auf der Grünen Woche. Kaffeefarbe, trüb, brauner feinporiger Schaum. Nase: Schoko, Malz, leicht fruchtig . Geschmack Fruchtig, sehr schön bitter, Mango, Mandarine. Langer Nachgang, immer stärker Grapefruit zu schmecken.

Bottle, batch #1522. Aroma is fresh hops, hints of toffee and mild caramel, some dark fruits. Deep brown, cloudy, medium beige head. Medium sweetness, medium bitter, dominated by hops, taste is hints of tropical fruits, orange, toffee and bread. Medium body, soft carbonation, some warm alcohol. Tasty, dominated by hops.

Bottle shared thanks to Mark. Slight gusher. Almost clear nice chestnut brown with huge bubbly beige head, very hard to pour. Fruity hops, lime, pineapple, mango, caramel, toffee, dried apricots, cinnamon, cloves, marzipan, garam masala, chestnuts. Medium sweet and very light bitter. Medium bodied with lots of carbonation. Very good stuff, I just wish it wasnt so ridiculously over carbonated.

500ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours hazy brown with a thick cream-coloured head. Aromas of rich chocolate malt, oranges, something woody like a newly-erected shed. Taste is beautifully balanced between sweet malt and bitter hops. Creamy texture, clean finish.
500 ml bottle. Pours deep brown with small off white head. Aroma of caramel, floral and nuts. Medium body with soft carbonation. Taste is medium sweet with nice bitter finish. Great beer.

Aroma: caramel, bread, nuts, roasty, 
Appearance: hazy brown with a beige head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

Tasty

Bottle (500 ml). Split 2-ways. Slightly hazy mahogany brown with a medium off-white head, moderate retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is of caramel, nuts, molasses, herbal, figs and dates. Taste is slightly sweet and quite nutty with a good caramel malt backbone, molasses, mild alcohol heat and light bitterness. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Nutty and herbal finish with a gentle alcohol warmth. Well balanced Imperial Brown Ale, easy to drink and never cloying. Theres a good malt depth.

Brown color with nice tan head. Aroma is nutty, malty, earthy hops, some thick black chocolate. Taste is black chocolate, surprisingly hoppy, more nuttiness, very complex. Carbonation is medium. An excellent Brown Ale.

Aroma of malt and nuts. Taste of malt, roasted, nuts and hops. A strange brown ale because of the hops and the alcohol (witch also is present) but its not bad at all. Is a bitter aftertaste. My label on this one was black with brown text, not like the picture on this side but its the same beer.
Brown ale massiccia e luppolata alla grande: malto e nocciole si sentono ma lasciano presto spazio ad un amaro deciso e avvolgente. Corpo medio, effervescenza giusta; molto buona!

Rating #1346 03.12.2014 - Christmas event at Liquor select. Dark brown pour with a weak bubbly tan foam that disappears quickly. Aroma is strong roast malts, coffee, caramel. Taste is bold, earthy, with a light smokiness. Bitterness is fairly assertive. This is delicious.

Pours a hazy, dark chestnut brown color and a 2.5 finger, light beige head that very slowly settles into a lasting cap/ring. The glass is left coated with chunks of soapy lacing. 

Roasted malt aroma with a surprisingly prominent floral hop presence. Slightly earthy with some grass, pine and hop resins countered by hints of caramel, toffee, toast and a bit of chocolate. Decent amount of roast but not burnt smelling at all with sweetness and hops balancing things out. 

On the fuller end of medium bodied with a strong earthy hop flavor thats countered by a lightly roasted malt backbone. Its surprising that the hops are the dominant flavor in an imperial brown ale. Dry and bitter with grass and resinous pine needle flavor lingering throughout into a pretty dry finish. Subtle roasted malt character countered by a touch of sweetness toward the end of the palate. Hints of toffee, caramel, nut and light chocolate rounding things out. Not a bad beer but too hoppy for the style in my opinion.
So nice for a brown. Rich and slight nut. Dark brown black and nice head. Hard imperial scent. Bottle.

Clear ruby-brown color with light brown head. Aroma has grassy hops combined with some caramel, dark cherries and nuts. Taste starts nutty, gets into caramel and roasty malts in the middle and hoppy and quite bitter in the finish and aftertaste. Body is medium-heavy, smooth but doesnt lack carbonation. Overall this is one of the better brown ales you can get.

Aroma: Fruity hops and some sweetness.
Flavour: Fruity bitter with caramel and a dry finish.
Colour: Dark reddish brown with an offwhite head. 
From: Tap @ Volby Ølmesse August 2015
Caramel, toffee and treacle, nice malty full body, very well balanced with piney hops. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, finish is well balanced light bitter toffee and niceness.
Tried at the Keans Head, Nottingham. Deep brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is fruity, chocolate and roasted malt taste follows this aroma. Great beer
Aroma of coffee, bitter chocolate, roasted malts and some dried fruits. Lovely rich roasted malts in the taste, some caramel and toffee with hints of brown sugar and plums.

At cellar temperature and into a snifter. Brilliant and radiant chestnut with ruby highlights is the body. Messy, thickly lacing off-white cap atop. Weirdly musty, herbal, dank and layered in nutty, peanut and roasted almond husks, and woody, phenolic spices is the nose. Quite rich on the palate. Some must and earth dampens a hugely malty and dessert-like sweet. Meaty, umami mid melds with dusty, flaky milk chocolate. Fills it out well. Medium body with a medial viscosity. 7.5% ABV adds fuel to make it slightly decadent. Good, malty length; all nutty and roasted. Perfectly ceding of those flavoursome malts. Hops play second fiddle. A grandish Brown. Done wonders for the style. (50cL, Brewed 15/01/15, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Dark brown colored, ruby hue, moderate beige creamy lasting head. Aroma is of caramel, bit toffee, nutty, toast, fruits. Taste is moderate+ sweet caramel, brown sugar and toffee, good on the nuts, some dried fruits - licorice, some chocolate notes and toasted bread finish. Low+ bitterness, sweet but still dryish finish with some roasted notes. Medium+ bodied and moderate carbonation, slightly sticky. Sweet but not too strong, very enjoyable.
(bottle at Bottle Park, Bratislava, Slovakia)
Malty, caramel, toffee, light roasted... Thick in the mouth with soft carbonation, medium sweet. Light hoppy bitterness. Easy drinking, and very tasty. I really enjoyed this a lot.
Классич& очень правиль& коричне& цвет. Аромат немного солодов& чуть жженый. Вкус мягкий, солодов& сладкий, с приятно& жженой горчинк& в конце. Отличны& браун эль!
Brown, long lasting head. Nose is brown malt, some hops. Taste is just bitterness and brown malt, need more dry hop
Buautiful brown, nearly no head. Aroma of caramel and malts; taste is sweet, caramel and roasted malts, gets a bit hoppy bitter in the end. Another great Nøgne!

(Nøgne Ø Takeover 24.6.2015). Pours dark brown with a small off-white head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, some spices. Soft carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Malty light bitter finish.

24-JUN-2015, draft @Taphouse.
Hazy Brown with low off-white head. Bread, Brown sugar, roast. Sweet, sugary, medium+ body, medium carbonation. Brown Aleish but more imperial:-)

Bottle. Deep brown with medium light brown, semi-densed head. Medicore head retention and lacing. Moderate malty (caramel) and toffee aroma combined with some nuts and smokey light smokey character. Some booze in the background noticable. Taste is semi-sweet wuth some medium bitterness in the end of degustation. Medium body, average carbonation, finish is bitter, semi-dry and nutty. In overall typical brown ale with some higher alc. vol. and more hoppier than usual. The good thing is that this beer is well balanced.
Bottle. Brown color with good foam. Aroma: malts, honey, hops, fruit and great hops. Taste: dark malt, biscuit with honey, fruit and pleasant hop bitterness.

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ Cervezorama 2.0.
A: Brown / Marron.
T/S: Malt, caramel, chocolate / Malta, caramelo, chocolate.

500ml bottle, pours cola brown, small off white head. Aroma is caramel, toffee and treacle, nice malty full body, very well balanced with piney hops. Creamy texture, soft carbonation, finish is well balanced light bitter toffee and niceness.

Bottle. Pours murky amber brown with a mostly fading beige head. Aroma of nuts, caramel, hint of smoke. Taste is of toffee, nutty, brown sugar, dark fruits, blackcurrant, some bitterness on the finish. Medium carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Nice
500ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours a dark brown with off-white head. Rich, full-flavoured malt, liquorice and dark toffee with some nuttiness. Lovely stuff.

Bottle 50cl. Pours hazy ruby brown with a light beige head, moderate lacing. Nose is toasted biscuity malt, toffee, chocolate, dark fruit. Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter, very mild sour. Medium body with a moderate carbonation. Aftertaste is malty with a lingering bitter finish. A nice brown ale, with a decent body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. A soft aroma of roasted malt, light nutty with some chocolate. The head is quite large, white to beige and creamy with a long duration. The body is dark brown. A quite nice malty taste of chocolate and roasted malt. The body is medium strong, very creamy with a soft carbonation.

April 25, 2015. Double Craftissimo day. Drank at home before Jocelyns birthday. Pours a hazy chestnut-brown, sudsy thin white head with big bubbles, spotty legs. Smells slightly like spicy vinegar and soy sauce, malt, wood, florals, cinnamon, toffee, seaweed. Aroma is a touch too salty. Taste is more balanced - more heavily bitter, spicy sweet malt, grassy herb, light yeast finish. Body is medium with some slickness, bitter and herbal, more flat/watery finish. Not bad, a big and flavourful brown ale with some Belgian-ish touches - bitter deep taste is the best bit.

Yields a mohagony brown color, with a decent, stable head.

Smells of chocolate, cane sugar, toffee, together with a fair amount of wood. Reveals a note of matured, fruity hops among a bready malt foundation. 

Has a medium body, with a fitting, lively carbonation.

Tastes of coffee, toasted malts and sugar, along with hazelnuts and a spiced note. Coffee is well pronounced, providing a convincing balance to sugar and molasses. Finishes fairly sweet, with a slick dryness shining through.

Tastes great, ranges between sweet and bitter in a convincing, complex way. Charred malts, old hops and coffee exhibit a convincing balance to molasses and caramel.

Bottle 50 cl.
Hazy brown, with light-brown head. Roasted malt, a bit nuttiness. Rather sweet, and long medium bitter.

(500ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, April 9 2015) Pours deep brown with a dense, moderately sized tan head and lace. Aroma of nutty dark malts with a little toffee and dark bread, softly roasted, spices, herbal hop notes. Flavour is toffee/caramel malts with lightish roast lending a bit of coffee/chocolate character, also some nuttiness. A bit of dark fruit, soft spices and herbal hops, a bit earthy. Lightly bitter finish from hops and roast. Pretty average mouthfeel and carb. Brown ales are not my favourite style but this was a really nice one, round flavours and a bit of interest.
From a bottle. Everything I like in a beer. I could drink this stuff all day, sure youll pay for it but hey, its worth it.

Tap at Roundhouse. Translucent, nearly opaque, cola brown pour. Some fizzy bubbly head. Aroma is spicy, earthy, very malty, and a bit metallic. Taste is very earthy with some cloves and cinnamon but a good amount of earthy hop bitterness.
Wzorzec klasy zero dla brown ale. Albo i nie bo bardzie mu do ciemnych piw. Po prostu bardzo dobre. Z Nogne O lepszy tylko porter

Świetne zbalansowane piwo. 
Kawowo - czekoladowe, goryczka też kawowa, kumulująca się. Wogóle ta "imperialność" przesunęła to piwo w stronę dobrego ciemnego stoutu, troche deliketnego w swojej paloności, palony słoneczni no i oczywiście kawowość.
Braun, rötlich. Viel Karamell in der Nase, Malz. Am gaumen Malz, Karamell, angenehme Herbe zum Schluss.

the aroma is caramel and spicy with hints of buckwheat and vanilla... the taste is caramel with notes of chocolate, coffee, licorice, toffee, dark fruits and some spices... slight hoppy bitterness... sweet and bitter dry aftertaste...

Draught at Braukunst Live München 2015.
Dark brown body, with a medium, creamy, light beige head.
Aroma of coffee, nuts and other smooth, dark malts, lots of fruity hops from the background.
Taste pretty much follows this, with a great balance between smooth malts and fruity hops.
Medium, quite creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes roasty, quite dry, zesty, with coffee and hops.

Tasty! Especially the balance between full malts and crisp hops is really pleasant. Pretty intense for a Brown Ale, but still very smooth to drink. Among the best beers of this style Ive had so far.

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a brown head. Aroma of malt, toast, caramel coffee, nuts. Flavor is malty, bread, nutty, coffee, chocolate, some dark fruit. Medium body, average carbonation. 110410

on tap at Braukunst Live, Munich. brown color, small white head. smells herbal, spices, some malty notes. full body, very slick, very little carbonation, light chocolate, herbal, light spices, light roasty malt finish. OKish, not my thing, dont like the herbal / medical notes so much.

Decent brown ale. Mostly malty, light caramel, bit nutty, some roasted notes, some fruitiness creeping around. Moderate to light sweetness, moderate to light bitterness.
Feels very well balanced, but nothing extraordinary or impressing about this one. Drinkable, but for one time try.

Pours hazy ruby brown with one finger of frothy light beige head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is toasted biscuity malt, toffee, chocolate, dark fruit. (7/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderate bitter, very mild sour. (7/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, lingering bitter finish. (3/5)

Not a bad brown ale at all. I generally find brown ales to be fairly malty and boring, but this one, even thought its still malty, isnt boring. I guess the wide variety of malts (six) and hops (three) are each bringing enough to the table that the ultimate product is fairly interesting. Im even getting a little tiny bit of tart and umame in there. Quite a nice brown. (15/20)

Pours a dark brown with a nice medium sized sticky beige head that slowly settles but leaves a bunch of lace. Aroma is rich maltiness, toasted malts, chocolate, toffee, caramel, moderate dark fruity esters, and nutty. Flavour is malty, toast, caramel, bread crusts, moderate bitterness, toffee, nutty, notes of coffee and faint alcohol on the finish.

Pours a lightly hazy brown with a frothy brown head that leaves good lacing up the glass. Aroma of toast, caramel malts, nuts, coffee and chocolate. Taste is sweet chocolate, coffee, toast, biscuit, nuts and light alcohol. Alcohol isnt harsh on the finish but provides a nice balance and warmth to this nice full bodied complex beer.
Bottle at bar. Poured a clear dark brown with slight off white head. Aromas were coffee, nuts and malts. Predominantly bitter taste, slightly oily (like most good coffees). OK
Aroma of light roasted malt, caramel, coffee, raisins, fruits, hint of chocolate, hops. Flavour is medium sweet with a medium bitter finish. Very tasty Imperial Brown Ale.
How: Bottle Appearance: brown, off-white head Aroma: nuts, chocholate, mild coffee.. Palate: medium body, a bit sticky texture, low carbonation.

Sporych rozmiarów piana nie jest tak trwała, na jaka wygląda na początku, pozostaje jednak obecna do końca. Barwa rubinowo-miedziana, dość klarowna (cały osad został na spodzie butelki). Aromat z butelki likierowo-karmelowy. Po przelaniu do szkła nadal czuć karmel, alkoholowe nuty mniej wyraźne, amerykańskich chmieli nie czuć, jest za to lekka czekolada. Ogólnie dość delikatny zapach. W smaku dużo przyjemniej, wyraźna gorzka czekolada kontrowana słodkim kakao i kawą espresso, delikatna paloność, wanilia, porto, kwaskowatości nie ma. Alkohol ułożony, przyjemnie rozgrzewa. Goryczka ziołowa, średnia do niskiej, fajnie dopełniająca całości. Piwo jest bardzo gładkie, aksamitne, nie jest ciężkie. Ogólnie przypomina dość nisko nagazowanego milk stouta o lekko podwyższonym alkoholu.
 Reasumując moim zdaniem jest to wyśmienity imperialny milk stout:) Prawdopodobnie świeże jest bardziej nachmielone, czuć owocowość Columbusa i Chinooka, większą goryczkę i mniej słodkich akcentów sherry i wanilii. Ja mam wersję z grudnia 2013 roku, czyli ponad rok leżakowaną i chyba to mi bardziej odpowiada. Przede wszystkim nie czuć rozpuszczalnikowych nut alkoholu, za to doszły przyjemne smaczki utlenienia ciemnego piwa.
Bottled. A reddish brown beer with a creamy beige head. Aroma is malty, caramel, roasted, nuts. Flavor is sweet malty, caramel. Nice balancing bitterness. Nice mouthfeel. Full body
Belle couleur brune; mousse crème assez fine; arômes maltés et de café; goût un peu liquoreux; finale legèrement amère
Poura a dark woody caramel with little to no head. Sweet smokey caramel aroma. Soft flavour, low carbonation, woody and ever so slightly woody.

Pours a warm golden brown with a thick and lasting light tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, mocha, caramel, dried fruit and some yeast. Medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation. Creamy taste with licorice, nuts and herbs. Long and refreshingly bitter finish with coffee and chocolate.
UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Little rye flavor, little bitter, felt bran, bread shades barley. At the end comes a warm fortress. Great!
Draft. Pours a hazy brown color. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, caramel, and malts.

Bottle. Tall Boys Beer Market, Leeds. Clear, dark red. Bubbly, sticky, tan head. Brown sugar. Chocolate malts. Light nuttiness. Some earthy hop. Taste is earthy dry. Light, sugary sweet. Roast bitter on the end. Medium body. Finishes dry, light bitter, with a residual sweetness.

Draught at Our Black Heart, Camden on 23 Jun 2012. Poured a hazy dark ruby, with a dense off white head. Aroma of fruitcake, roasted nuts and big malt. Some spicy flavours, with caramel, grain and peal. Finish was Christmas pudding, toffee and some resinous hops.

Superbe couleur marron foncée, fine pellicule de mousse beige. Nez automnal de fruits secs : noix, noisettes, marrons, caramel, bois. Bouche maltée, saveur de fruits secs (les mêmes), café, biscuit. Les houblons sont discrets mais présents. Amertume modérée, Corps légèrement liquoreux. Belle longueur en bouche. Une belle réussite dinspiration belge.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into an English pint glass. Dark brown with bi light brown head. Aroma is chocolate, medium/light body, low carbonation, and some medium-bubble lacing. Taste is chocolate and some nuts.
Deep chestnut brown, beige head. Dried fruit nose, yeast, nuts, brown sugar. Ripe fruit taste, sweet, caramel malt, yeast, hint of coffee. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.

Bottle from Den Nordiske Ølhandel, Copenhagen - dark brown pour with a tan head. Big toasty heavy malty aroma and taste, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, nutty, some spicy hop bite in there, great bitterness, really liked this.

Shared bottle at Draft House. Dark brick red, hazy, small white head. Aroma is syrupy sweet yet with a savoury bovril element. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is sweet toffee, resin, dry yeasty Belgian strong ale character, finishes spicy/peppery. Nice enough - not really my style.

Draught pint at Smith Street Taps in Singapore. Sweet caramel aroma. Dark chocolate brown in colour with no head. Light carbonation, medium body. Lightly hopped. Taste of chocolate, smoke, malt and toffee. Quite a heavy ale.

from Mise en Bière - pours a hazy brown beer under a very foamy beige head; solidly toasted biscuity maltiness with notes of hazelnuts; low carbonation, sweet and full-bodied, light heavy, low bitterness, a gentle earthiness and long biscuity malty notes in the finish; gently flowery
Poured medium reddish amber with a dense tan head. Aroma of coffee, dark fruit and roast malt. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, milk chocolate, nuts. Very nice.

Bottle@ Home from beerkings.it (online shop). Birra marrone, riflessi rubino velata, schiuma beige non troppo fine ma decisamente persistente. Aroma piuttosto intenso tostato, di cioccolato fondente, caffè in polvere, nocciole e noce moscata. Leggermente erbaceo da luppolo. Gusto abboccato, soprattutto allingresso dove predominano frutta secca (nocciole) speziatura (noce moscata) e poi un tostato piacevole, tra il cioccolato ed il caffè. Corposa, calda, rotonda e morbida al palato. ben equilibrata ed armonica.
Pours dark brown with a medium head. Aroma: caramel, dark fruit. Taste: hoppy, dark malt. Good beer.

Caramel, nuts, Chocolate, coffee and some dried fruits in the aroma. Brown with a tan head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Full body with a soft carbonation. Overall a really delicious Brown Ale, rich in flavour, full body and some warming alcohol at the end.
Bottle in the Town Street Tavern, Horsforth. Pours a chestnut colour with a thin cream head. Starts off sweet with a little spice, red fruit before a nice chocolatey finish. Vey good.
On tap at Liquid Laundry, Shanghai. Pours hazy brown with a white head. Aroma of malt with some coffee. Sweet finish.
Great, "cola-like" appearance, nice head, gorgeous lacing. Aroma of hoppy resin, coffee, toffee, chocolate and nuts. Great taste. One of the best brown ales Ive ever drunk.

Bottle: Served in a Duvel glass:
Hazy brown beer with a small head.
Nose is mostly malts with some hints of caramel, coffee and toast.
Good coffee flavour (but not to strong), also malts, caramel, toast (light roast), some bitters, light dry and even some malty sweetness while not that sweet at all. Very well balanced!
A bitter, toasty, caramel ish/more malty aftertaste with a light smokey/mocha touch.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than medium balanced and a creamy texture.
Very well balanced which makes it more of a pleasure to drink and quite an easy drinker as well. Nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: En flaska lagrad fyra år. Smak och doft av humle, malt, karamell, brunt socker, choklad med aningar av nötter och rostade toner. Frisk humle, välbalanserad med jämna smaker som ligger länge i gommen. En riktigt fin imperial ale.

Bue en bouteille de 50cl, couleur marron foncée, peu de mousse, et effervescence moyenne, une bière très caramel en début de bouche et une continuité sur le café et fin de bouche chocolat vraiment excellente.

Pours deep brown with tan head. Aroma is loads of sweet toffee, roasted malt and some sweet chocolate tones. Round and sweet palate. Aftertaste is more toffee, sweet, caramel and a nice noble hop bite. Overall: What a beer! Well made!

Bouteille 50cl, batch# 1111, BB 21/01/2017, bottled 21/01/2014.
Ambrée claire, col épais blanc cassé.
Arôme est malté, grillé, léger fruité noir rappelant les figues et raisins secs. Léger bouquet houblonné arrive en rétro-nasal.
Palais est agréable pour ne pas dire délicieux, de belles notes de malts nottament grillé donne une belle touche de torréfié. Houblonné plus subtil apparait en fin de bouche ajoutant ainsi une brève amertume. Note une pointe de citronné, léger herbacé, et en se réchauffante la bière gagne sur ce côté fruité. Je note aussi une pointe de douceur caramélisée qui reste intense dans la bière et même un rappel de gingerbread.

bottle from liquorland Tga. An unexpected find. Brewed 08/2011 & Best Before 2016. Believable - was tasting good 3 years in. Ale is dark brown, nearly porter colour. Good fluffy head. A little sediment. Looking and smelling intriguing though. Good hops make taste reasonably lively, despite low carbonation. nice soft malt flavors run though also - nutty & caramel being most evident. Looking forward to more Ol from Norge!

Hoppy nose with lot of dark malts notes. Chocolate, nuts, cocoa and caramel. In taste theres nice tuned cooperation of notes recognizable usually in IPAs and Stouts: roasted black malts and medium, well fitted bitter finish.Creamy and smooth body - like a liquid desert!

500 ml bottle. Clear dark brown with tanned head. Smell is malty and burned sugar with some hops. Taste is full bodied roasted malt with coffee and biscuits with a finishing dry hoppiness. Medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Brązowe jak sama nazwa wskazuje, z piękną pianą która ładnie krążkuje na szkle. 
W aromacie, kawa, ciasteczka, palone słody, trochę karmelowe.
Alkohol dobrze zamaskowany, słodowe, czekoladowe, palone, z odrobiną owoców. 
Wysycenie średnie w stronę wysokiego, z absolutnym brakiem goryczki.﻿

50cl bottle shared. Pours dark brown with a HUGE beige head that grows in the glass for a while before slowly starting to disappear. Smells of biscuits, roasted malts, light coffee, some spices. Taste starts sweet with lots of biscuits and coffee. Very good aftertaste with burnt sugar and bitter ground coffee notes. Oily texture, low carbonation. Excellent.

Bottle. Dark brown, really thick head, that creates nice lace on a glass, but not clear. Delicate aroma mainly of nuts, dark bread and chocolate. Taste is biiter-sweet well balanced and alcohol is perfectly covered. Its quite smooth for its ABV :) Nice job!
Marron très foncé avec une petite mousse marron. Larôme de la mélasse, sucre brun et un peu dhoublon et alcool. Le goût est similar avec une finition assez amer dans la finale.
Bottle. Aroma light smoke, light coffee and chocolate. Clear dark brown colour. Good head. Taste is rich malty, chocolate, roasted, caramel. Very good. ABV hidden well. I really like it.

from bottle at mondial 2014, mtl. hazy light Brown, orange tint, with a nice medium dark beige head showing a good retention and lacing. strong and sweetened bitter coffee, burnt caramel, burrnt nuts, maple toffee, dates and figs. some dark red fruitiness. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily and sticky, assertive and almost balanced coffee-piney finish. tasty.
caramel, coffee, resin, basement aromas, earthy, clove, licorice, brown, cloudy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter,

Bottiglia 50 cl bevuta a casa.
Marrone scuro con bella schiuma molto persistente.
Malti torrefatti ed una punta di nocciola, si sente anche l'alcol.
Corpo medio con carbonazione fine.
Non il mio genere preferito ma comunque buona!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle from Bottle Park, Bratislava. Dark brown color with thick beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, red fruits, citrus hops. Roasted malt in taste with red fruits, citrus hops with grapefruit, grapefruit zest, pines. long fruity, hoppy bitter finish. Good.
Pours a very cloudy dark brown with lots if sediment. Not much aroma but lots of dark malt, coffee and dmoke flavors. A very good brown ale overall.

Apparence de cola, film de mousse couleur crème en surface ; mi-épaisse. Noisettes grillées, et boisée en nez. Des houblons et du sucre dorge apparaissent également. En bouche, cest une brune presque parfaite, léquilibre des saveurs est magnifique, la rondeur est belle, adéquate, et la finale houblonnée nest pas une bombe damertume inutile. Cette bière est une référence du genre, elle appuie sur tous les bons boutons.
East of Everything (4-Jun-2014) Fruit roasted caramel malt aroma. Brown colour, low head&suds lace.Sweet caramel malt herb flavour.Bitter herbal caramel malt finish.

Butelka 0.5L.

Wygląd: Brunatne, klarowne z rubinowymi prześwitami. Piana bardzo obfita, jasnobeżowa, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa. Głośno syczy zmieniając się w duże bąbla i opadając.


Aromat: lekko metaliczny, chlebowy, kawa rozpuszczalna, trochę czekolady, czuć amerykańskie chmiele: dojrzałe owoce, melon, mango i trochę żywicy ale nie przykrywają pozostałych aromatów - nie dominują. Lekka nuta alkoholowa.

Smak: Kawa zbożowa, tosty, skórka od ciemnego pieczywa, chmiel i to całkiem sporo. Słodkie ale ze sporą kontrą chmielową. Goryczka jak na styl wysoka, chmielowa (ziołowa) kawowa i alkoholowa.

Odczucie: Dużo ciała, piwo gęste, syropowate, kremowe, wysycenie średnie+

Całość: Całkiem niezłe piwo choć mocno słodkie i alkoholowe jak na 7.5% ABV.

Appearance: Dark brown/black with 3 finger beige/tan head.
Aroma: Chocolate, prune, treacle, peat, umami, resinous, liquorice, fruit cake, malt loaf.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sweetness with low sourness and a slight saltiness.
Palate: Thick fairly smooth texture, medium body, lively on opening but generally average carbonation, dry, burnt bitter toffee, treacle, earth, malty finish.
Comments: Very tasty and glass lace.

weak memories about but still - medium+ bodied, medium dark brown, with beige, thick, rich foam; within flavor - toasted malt light bitterness, no sour touch from amber malt, for imperial brown ale it is not so malty and "brown" as I prefer, no nutty hints. Just good ale with lots of dark malt tones.

0,5L bottle, BB 18.02.2017. Pours clear brown-dark ruby with light tan head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is intense caramel, sweetness, dark fruits, and roast. Taste is intense caramel, sweetness, dark fruits, roast, and burned notes. Finish is fruity dry bitter. Alcohol is well hidden. Overall: great brew.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Bottle 0.5 at home. Batch nro: 6222. Brygget: 280411. Best före: 280414. Colour is dark brown with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Hints of coffee, chocolate, some fruits, hints of citrus and roasted malts. Pretty soft but lacks of maltiness. Maybe hasnt aged very well. Re-rate at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. From the tap. Colour is reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Nuts, fresh fruits, chocolate, nougat, some harsh chocolate and malts. Very fresh and drinkable. Very good. Probably best brown ale I have had. Points 3.4 -> 3.8.

Not huge on wow factor but lovely, drinkable, definitely on the drink again list. Clear ruby brown with a thin tan head. Aroma has caramel, nuts and malts. Flavour has sweet malts, brown sugar. I like it.

Recenzja z 22.01.2014. Kolor brunatno-czerwony, srednie jednolite zmetnienie. Piana wysoka, bardzo powoli opada, zostawia gruba warstwe, troche oblepia szklo. W zapachu karmel, kawa, czekolada, owocowe estry, lekkie orzechy, srednio intensywny alkohol, minimalna owocowa i ziolowa nuta chmielowa. W smaku pelne, slodkie, aromaty jak w zapachu, smak malo intensywny. Goryczka niska, bardzo mocno lodygowa z minimalna amerykanska nuta, wzmacniana przez alkohol i kawe. Wysycenie za wysokie, piwo bylo przegazowane.
Finally, a brown ale that is actually very good. Strong malty body, with sweet herbs and fruits, but also some very present hops. Balanced and rich, good beer.
Bottled. Warming alcohol, roasted malt, espresso apply for aroma and taste. Color is dark brown, head vanished quickly but left a thin texture. Overall not so my beer style, but drinkable.
Mørk brun farge med lys beige skum. Lukter sjokolade, kaffe og malt. Sjokolade og kaffe kommer mere fram i smaken. God bitter ettersmak.

Punertava, tumman ruskea ja muodostaa vaalean beigen vaahdon. Tuoksu on paahtunut, leipäinen, pähkinäinen, hieman suklainen ja hieman hedelmäinen. Maku on paahtunut, rusinainen, sitrushedelmäinen, katkera ja lakritsinen.

Brown 0,5L btl 7,5% pours a tiny head on the dark brown body, some lacings.
Scents of chocolate malts, caramel malts, fruity sweet scents overall.
Very smooth gentle creamy chocolate taste, creamy malts.
Good body. Smooth carbonation. Fine on palate.
Finishes slightly flourish, the chocolate malts still dominate this beer, lingering with fruity notes,
Overall a decent beer for afterdinners, cozy times and so on.

Aroma: caramel, milk chocolate, prunes, dried dark fruits. Appearance: dark brown, small to medium frothy head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: roasted malts, very light hints of smoke, lighter than the aroma, hints of alcohol. Overall: quite amazing Brown Ale, great aroma. Bottle from Beer Hawk, England.

Bottle. Pours a deep mahogany, big off-white head with excellent retention and lacing. Nose is a whole lotta malt, some caramel, faint smokiness. Mouth is medium bodied, subtly semisweet, malt forward, plenty of caramel, dates, some roast, toasted pumpernickel, molasses, faint smoky flavor like in the nose. ABV is nicely hidden, and this is a pretty straightforward brew. Skål!

Bottle 2013 from The Fox, Shipley - opaque dark brown, slim off-white head. Aroma of roast malts, caramel, dark fruits, burnt sugar. Repeated in the taste. Exceptionally nice - full bodied, great hops. Nice late bitterness. Superior beer.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner großen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, exotisch fruchtig, hopfig. Geschmack sehr röstmalzig fruchtig, dunkle Früchte, fruchtige Bitterkeit.

50cl Bottle from De Bierkoning. Brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of caramel, leaves, juniper, alcohol, some grapefruit, weird. Flavour is medium-sweet, caramel/toffee without the sweetness, a little salty, leafy hops, alcohol, something else I cant put my finger on, a little herbal. Bitter finish. Medium-bodied, a little sticky. Not convinced.

Bottle @ home. Aged 2,5 years. brown reddish color with a big beige head and nice lacing. Aroma is initially intense milk chocolate from the foam. Aroma is sweet and quite vinous with milk chocolate, raisins, dates, hazelnut, vanilla, coffe and light roast notes. some red berries and some well integrated alcahol. Taste has more booze, a bit sticking. Flavor is sweet with dark chocolate, coffee, red berries, nuts, earthiness and some burnt roastiness. Finishes drier and somewhat tart. Mid-high body and high soft carbonation.
1/8/2012. From bottle. Pours copper color with a tan head. Aromas are sweet and malty with hints of spices. Caramel and malt flavors with booze showing. A bit earthy on the finish.

Dark red brown, small offwhite head. Spicy, nutty, malty aroma. Taste the same with clearly present alcohol which slowly moves into the background as the beer heats up a little. Still a little rough, though. Well balanced bitterness. Lively carb, creamy mouthfeel.

(bottle) pours a murky amber-brown colour with a frothy light beige head. aroma of popcorn and bread crusts, quite husky, with hints of yeast and hazelnuts. flavour is mostly the same, lots of yeast, hazelnuts and husky roasted malts, with a soft lemony tartness in the finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

Birra molto interessante che può ricordare una scotch ale, con note caramellate, di malti tostati, nocciola e un tocco leggermente fruttato che si confonde con la presenza alcolica, forse leggermente eccessiva per i suoi sette gradi. Molto buona comunque!
dark brown, great beige head. aroma: nuts, bit earthy. In taste malty sweetness, nuts, light bitterness. Coffee-bitter finish.
Tastes mainly of nuts and dried fruit. Surprisingly light, very heavily carbonated. Good beer.

Anmeldelse nr 300! Mørk brun med medium skum. Milde toner av sjokolade, mørke frukter og malt. Smaken er brent malt, sjokolade og mørke frukter. Mild og god! Medium konsistens og litt tørr. God munnfølelelse, som rundes av med en veldig mild bitterhet.

A dark brown beer with a medium, dense and beige head. The nose is rich of malts and bread, dark fruits, hint of roastiness, red currants and chocolate. Taste of rich malts and bread, riped fruits, herbs from hops, maybe hint of chocolate. Smooth and pleasant to drink with medium body and smooth carbonation. Liquid fruitfbread with smooth presence. Not magical but tastefull.

Color rojizo oscuro con espuma beige densa. aromas de caramelo, regaliz, sirope, frutos rojos. En boca es densa con un inicio dulce, como de regaliz y sale con un amargor seco y especiado agradable. Muy rica.
05/02/2014 --> Lúpulo Feroz - Oviedo. Cerveza sin filtrar con buen cuerpo y bastante lupulada tiene un toque a caramelo que es apreciable, compensada y fácil de beber. Buena cerveza Noruega

Reddish brown hazy beer with a beige head. Aroma has chocolaty, malty, sugary and cake kind of sweetness. Flavor is malty, chocolaty, cakey and little roasted. Finish is long and sweet with some bitterness and little sourness. Full and slightly stingy palate. A really enjoyable smooth beer.
On tap at Biercab. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Malt, nut, caramel aroma. Acidic, malt taste, with some sweetness from caramel and some chocolate. Medium to full body.

Bottle, 7 months old. Aroma: intensive and complex, roasted malt, dark chocolate, some resin. Black colour, beautiful frothy head. Medium bitterness. Full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Great beer.

0.5L bottle. Looks like grain coffee with small creamy hat. Fruity and a musty wood aroma. Little grainy, fruity, toffee, coffee with milk, very little rotten egg, mouldy flavors. Too light bitterness on the end. Drinkable, but price is too loud for this beer.

Pours brown with medium beige head. Aroma - chocolate, roasted malt and some sweetness of an alcohol. Tastes nice. Drinkable, but not the 
Nøgne Øs best beer in my opinion.
This beer has a slight sourness to balance the sweetness. Very good beer. Nice full bodied with sweetness and some nuttiness. Very good beer.

500ml bottle from Dutchs. Probably at least a year old. Dark brown color. Good thin khaki head with great retention. Leaves good thicker ropes and reaches of lace. Medium to bigger body. Good smooth lighter carbonation. Easy drinking. Earthy hop, more bitter than the typical brown ale. Some nice chocolate malt. Moderate to bigger bitter, light sweet. Very tasty imperial brown. Its held up amazingly well. Not anywhere as sweet as I thought it would be. Actually nicely on the bitter and hoppy end of the spectrum, where I like it...
Good brown ale. Taste has some caramel, with a little hint of coffee. Medium mild,not too bitter.

Thanks, Terry, for bringing this to our New Years party. Opaque dark brown, sudsy head, low streaks of lace. Taste is burnt malt with coffee overtones. It moves cleanly through the palate to a sudden harsh bittering and a bite like strong alcohol in the finish. This is a sipping brew; I dont think I could manage much of it in gulps.
Pours a dark orange beer with a good creamy tanish white head. Smells chocolate, vanilla. Tastes chocolate, vanilla, some coffee and fruity. Average carbo, medium body and a oily texture. I like it.
Troebele chocolade bruine kleur met een volle crème kraag. Ruikt chocolade, gebrand, hop. Smaakt bijzonder. Hop, chocolade.

Imperial brown Ale pours a deep brown with a thin head of small off white bubbles. The Nose is foremostly sweet of the higher alcohol content. However, there are Undercurrents of dark fruit, roasted nuts and molasses. Taste is at first of roasted nut and grain that resolves into a bit of yeast. A very nice beer. The higher alcohol content does not detract from the overall flavor of the beer. Body is smooth, a little silky. FInishes with just a faint touch of bitters.

Botella de 50 cl en casa 20-12-13. Muy buena maravilla de Imperial Brown ale al estilo noruego. Aromas a malta nórdica intensa con tostado y algo quemado con algo de caramelo - toffe- bastante intensos, algo de cacao. Sabores a maltas tostadas rusticas y con carácter nórdico muy destacado con final algo especiado y ligero. Cuerpo medio - fuerte de color negro intenso con espuma algo oscura no muy persistente quedando con ligera capa y corona. Sensación alcohólica bastante destacada sobre todo según va calentando, aumentando también su densidad en boca. Muy buena, como casi todo lo de esta casa, Imprescindible repetir.
Keg at Cherry Reds (city centre), Birmingham. Frothy head. Creamy. Coca-cola flavoured sherbet. Nice. Sweet. Thick.
Aroma is fruity, some yeast, some chocolate, a bit dusty. Flavour is creamy chocolate, light roast, some hops and coffee. Nice one.

How: Bottle.
Where: Man in the Moon, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy brown colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Caramel, raising, sugar, alcohol.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, fruit, caramel, raisin.

backlog review. Bottle, pours chestnut with medium sized beige head. Carbonation is medium, Nose is milk chocolate, lightly roasted malt, caramel, and brown sugar. Flavor is similar to aroma with caramel malt, roasted malt, and some bitter hops rounding out the profile. Nice brown.

Hazy dark brown colour, firm light beige head. Fruity aroma, caramel, toast, raisins, light coffee. Light bitter flavour, quite sweet, coffee and fruity notes. Finish caramel and coffee, quite fresh. Im not a fan of brown ale as a style, but I quite love this one!
(Draught @ Emelisse Home Brew Day, Kamperland 2013)

Aroma has earthy hops, raisins, some alcohol. Rich mouthfeel with lots of malt and juicy hops. Finish has caramelly hops with medium bitterness and something creamy. Nice but the aroma is occasionally a bit sharp. Too expensive to have more than once - offerings from Fullers and some others provide much better value at the same level of quality.
Mahogany pour with a large frothy white head and clinging lace. Sweet caramel malt flavour with hint of hops and toffee. Nice bitterness.

Cloudy, opaque, deep brown pour with two fingers of beige head that has some staying power. Roasty and spicy on the nose with some nice fresh accents. Toffee and nuts. Has a bit of a cola nut feel on the palate with some nice spicy underpinnings and enough warmth and bitterness to keep it interesting.
Roasty smell and taste. Very easy to drink. Nicely balanced bitterness. My favorite brown ale to this day.

Big Beer Tasting at The Brownstone, Round Three: shared 500 ml bottle. Clear darkest copper with an amber hue, tan foam head fades. Sweet nutty malty aroma. Dark roast sweet caramel malt forward, some nuttiness, chocolate and coffee, hints of herbal spicy hop. Soft carbonation, medium-full bodied, moderately hopped. Light bitterness and vinous towards the finish. NFL (Not For Lagerboys) Nicley paired with a beer bellied pork BLT on sourdough.

Slightly hazy and amber brown in colour. Small beige head. Sweet aroma with a hint of caramel. Taste is fruity, sparkly and definite quality caramel and notes of bitter chocolate. Perfectly balanced bitterness.
Mørk brun med beige skum. Malt og gjærlukt. Litt karamell i smaken, kjenner alkoholen ganske godt. Lite kullsyre.

Bottle, batch 985-A, brewed 6/13. Brown, murky. Dark nutty, slight woody, malty nose. Some ashy notes, pine twigs & other foresty aromas. Full bodied, slightly oily texture, but feels quite dry still, long finish. Dry chocolate, roasted nuts. Dark old malty, some barley wine-ian port and yeasty dough. I think this needs more rest/cellaring to really be enjoyable, theres a bit too much yeastyness and sharp corners right now. Good flavours though.

Very nice, thick, 2-3 finger ruby/tan head. Pours the color of dark root beer. Can detect a pleasing alcohol and roast on the nose. First sip is marvelous. Has a coffee-like aftertaste. For a style that can tend to be a little boring or at least predictable after a while, this is a good change. Another great one from a great brewery.

Aroma: The smell has roasted tones, sweet dark fruits like raisins and dates and dark chocolate.Appearance: The beer is dark brown, nearly black, a tan head, good lacing and some curtains.Taste: The taste is sweet, brown toast, dates and some very dark bitter chocolate.Palate: Medium carbonation, small soft bubbles and an oily sweet feeling, a dry finish.Overall: A really good balanced beer with lots of malty tones.Note: Bottle sampled at a beer tasting at De Klomp, Linköping, Sweden. Reviewed 2010-10-16.

Bottle. Murky dark brown body. Aroma has earthy hops, raisins, some alcohol. Rich mouthfeel with lots of malt and juicy hops. Finish has caramelly hops with medium bitterness and something creamy. Nice but the aroma is occasionally a bit sharp. Too expensive to have more than once - offerings from Fullers and some others provide much better value at the same level of quality.
Bottle from drink shop, tallinn. Hazy dark brown color, nice light brown head. Aroma is mixed roasted malts and some coffee, sweet notes. Balanced little hoppy roasty taste, coffee, fruits.

50 cl. bottle, poured in to a snifter. 2012 Vintage. Dark brown colour with a small, dense lightly tanned head. Sweet aroma with nuts, rich caramel malts, dark dried fruits, brown sugar and light licorice. Some vinous alcohol, almost port-like. Taste is sweet. Full, body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Long lasting dry and slightly bitter finish with rich caramel malts and overripe fruits. This beer seems bigger than the 7,5 % alc. suggests. Really good.

A superior brown (even categorized as an English strong), this one pours a very dark brown with ample tan head. Nose is malty, sweet, and spicy...very full. Flavor really accents a sweet maltiness at the front, followed by some bitter hops notes in the finish. Big flavor, which some browns lack. Very tasty.

500ml bottle. Hazy copper color. Medium size, off-white, thick head, stays. Malty, roast, dusty, milky and slightly ashy aroma. Nice malty roast, milky, mild sweetness, nuts in flavor. Perfect balance. Heaven in my mouth!

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.dark brown with medium brown head plus yeast flakes. Dark sweat malty aroma. Some bitter,light sweat taste. Roasted flavour.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with big fluffy off white head, malty hop aroma with a trace of pine, taste is malty, fruity dark berries, getting a hint of pine hop, vanilla some wood, a bitter finish.

Aroma is some sweetness, coffee beans and chocolate. muddy brown colour with tan head. taste is light sweetness, light bitterness. medium body, average carbonation, finish has more bitterness than the taste. the combination of aroma and finish makes this a nice beer that goes from chocolate coffee to some dry bitterness in the taste.

Medium brown beer, big tan head, nice lacing. Nose is very malty, nuts, caramel, brown sugar, dried fruit. Taste is caramel, licorice, raisins, burned malt, wood notes. Bitterness, warm alcohol, raisins and malty hints in the finish. Bitterness, alcohol and dark chocolate in the finish. Smooth texture, smooth carbonation, medium to full body.

660ml bottle at home. Pours deep brown with a greyish hue. Aroma of maple syrup and honey, malt, soy and fish sauce. Medium body with slight sourness in the beginning and strong malty notes in the taste. Nice.

small offwhite frothy head. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. clear average brown body. aroma: moderate malty, caramel, light coffee. if: moderate sweet. ff: moderate sweet salty moderate bitter; average duration. Thick black non-amber pour. Surprised by this, very stout like, malty and big alcohol kick.

Dark brown color, small head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, dark berries. Taste has roasted malt, hops, dark fruits, chocolate, yeast. Great balance of sweetness, dryness and bitterness. Full body, average carbonation. Nice and complex dark ale.
Svart farve med lite lyst skum. Lukt av malt, bær og sjokolade. Smak av malt, bær, frukt, kaffe og sjokolade. Vinmonopolet.
God duft av malt og rosin. Lite skum. Fin rødbrun farge. Fin smak av rosin ig karamell.

7.5% about 71 NOK from Vinmonopolet. A very dark brown, almost black with red tints & a beige head. The aroma is smooth mellow chocolatey malts with caramel. Great taste, nutty, caramel, milk chocolate, with a sweet malty finish & a hint of bitterness. This beer is really well executed, sweet but not cloying with a good complexity. Great stuff.
Bottle nice dark brown color tan head Aroma is dark berries hops and roasted malts aftrtaste is great :-)

Bottle at Deans Birthday Tasting, August 2013. Poured a dark mahogany with a frothy white head. The aroma is weak rich malty and sweet alcohol. The flavour is medium bitter with some weak liqourice, nuts and roasted malt on the smooth palate.

Dark brown with a white, lasting, frothy, non-lacy head. Smells of dark malt, chocolate, blueberries, and roast. Medium to full oily body. Tastes of caramel and dark malt with a dark chocolate bitter ashy roast finish.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma is chocolate, raisin and dark fruits. Bit yeasty. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter.

50cl bottle shared, courtesy of JmGreenUK @ Deans Birthday tasting.
Thin creamy tan head. Murky brown pour. Nice brew.

Pours a murky, brown, almost black colour, has a tiny, tan head which stays, but leaves no lacing. This ones really malty with notes of toffee and sugar, but theres also some roastiness to the flavour, with subtle hints of coffee and toasted bread, and what could only be described as fruitiness. It actually reminded me of fruitcake. The carbonation is soft and the palate is almost creamy. The finish had a slightly sour taste to it. Loved it.

Brown color with off white head. Aroma of figs, cherries, liquorice, dark fruits, fermented fruits, candy sugar. Taste is light sweet, a bit sour, light bitter, really good balance. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation

500 ml bottle. Served in a pint glass, the beer pours very dark brown with an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. Aroma is nice, the brew smells like nuts, toasted malt, caramel, molasses, chocolate and some dark bread. It tastes like nuts, molasses, dark bread, caramel and roasted malt, and some dark fruit and coffee. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its smooth and creamy and has moderate carbonation. I think its a good brew overall, Id buy it again. $8.49 a bottle.

Bottle 50cl. Large off white head. Aroma spreads out in the room. Color is brown. Aroma is sugar, rum, caramel, chocolate malt. Flavour is still sugar, rum and caramel. Even more candy like for taste.

Bottle @ Daniel, 18/7 2013. Dark brown, medium tan head, okay lacing that doesnt last. Aroma, malty, caramel, roasted notes, nutty, sweet, slight hops. Taste, malty, nutty, bitter hops, bread, roasted notes, . Leaves long bitter aftertaste. Little dry.
(500ml bottle thanks to JD) cloudy brown, lasting wispy bubbles. Nose of chocolate, dark fruit, cream. Taste of chocolate malt, rich, alcohol, medium body.

Bottle, brewd 4.5.2012, batch# 800. Pours a dark cola with a very small, off-white head. Aroma is a lot of chocolate with a dash of vanilla. Some roast, light touch of coffee. Taste is roast, chocolate and coffee in a nice mix. Strong flavor, a bit sweet, a tad sour, very full, complex. Assaults the mouth really well. Somewhat wooden hoppiness, not unpleasantly so though. Light touch of dark fruit. Very full flavor. Palate is medium with some carbonation. Nicely balanced.
Kjøpte fra vinmonopol på Levanger. Godt med skum og herlige bobler. God maltsmak og fyldig avslutning. Perfekt til grilling og sol.
Not a fan. Good quality, well balanced but caramel was too present and not enough bitterness. Alcohol well hidden. Good beer but not sure Ill buy it again.

Pours a dark brown with medium tan head. Diminishes quickly with a little lacing. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, bread and has an apparent solventy aroma. Taste is much of the same with a much stronger solvent touch. Finish is slightly chemically and sweet.
a rich, generous and robust brown beer. excellent weight... i felt the big hops were a little at odds with the package- a year sitting in the dark and i think this could be a gem.

Deep brown, very lively and hard to pour clear. Aroma: fruit, caramel, a little smoke and spice, touch of marshmallow. Rich initially sweet body, light candy notes, touch of spiced fruitcake, honey, faint tartness, finish is again smoky-sweet with a touch of cinder toffee and a vinous note.

50 cl flaske, Svane Pub, 7,5 %, 14. juni 2013.
Øllet er klart brunt og mellemmørkt. Lille skumkrone. 
Aroma: lidt typisk en Brown Ale. 
Mundsmag: øllet føles rundt og med moderat kulsyre. Smagen er maltet og med bitterhed og minimal sødme.
En lidt almindelig Brown Ale for min smag.

and alcholic brown sugary tones in aroma. A bit of sweet sugar in taste before the nutty tones take over. 
After that some additional fruity notes appears, even if they stay in the background. Theres also some 
bitter chocolate notes in flavor. Has a rather vinous finish. Feels quite soft and smooth.

Bottle - 500ml. Cloudy brown body with a good off-white foamy head. Nice, complex, well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with caramel, oaky, and yeasty hints. Its robust malty/hoppy taste carries oaky and vineous notes. Ends with a warming bittersweet finish. Good stuff.

Bottle. Glas wasn't available. Black/brown beer. Taste: Sweet rich taste. Smell of chocolate.

Super dark brown with creamy medium head. Smells.. Dark cooked fruits, big malts, caramel, toffee and coffee hints. Tastes.. Dark roasted grains, some dark fruits like a Belgian strong ale, big malts and some coffee hints.

500 ml bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating.  Pours very hazy nearly pitch black color with a nice 2 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers.  Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass.  Aromas of caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, light roast, light chocolate, dark bread, floral, light dark fruits, light pine, and toasted earthiness.  Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of malty notes with slight hops; with good strength.  Taste of caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, dark bread, light roast, light chocolate, floral, light pine, and toasted earthiness.  Minimal bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, molasses, toast, toffee, dark bread, light roast, light chocolate, floral, and toasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance and complexity of toasted malt flavors with light hops; with nice robustness and zero cloying flavors after the finish.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very creamy and moderately slick mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent imperial brown ale.  All around nice balance, complexity, and robustness of flavors; and very smooth to sip on.  A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle from Sola Vinmonopol. Dark brown with creamy full brown head. Sweet caramel malty aroma. More sweet malts and a light integrated alcoholprecense. Smooth, oily & creamy

Grande versione firmata norvegia, per questa imperial brown, che si presenta con un bel colore nero impenetrabile. Al naso caffè e cioccolato in evidenza, mentre in bocca compare meravigliosamente anche la parte luppolata, che le dona un armonia eccellente. Grandi...

Noisettes, caramel, chocolat enroulés dans la résine de houblons anglais. Le corps moyen et leffervescence bien calibrée lui procure une buvabilité assez franche. Une autre intéressante bouteille du sniper slovaque!!

0.5L bottle.  Dark brown \ black color.  Light tan head.  Aroma of nutty, dark roasted malts, some salted molasses, and roasted malt.  Burnt flavors.  Lots of roast, burnt grains, some herbal hops.  Tastes like earth and pumpernickel bread.  Finishes like a strong Porter.  
(3624)

500ml bottle from IPB.
Appearance : Dark amber with med foamy and creamy brown head.

Aroma : Piny and resinous hops with brown sugar. Quite malty, light red fruits. Slightly citrusy.

Taste : Citrusy and piny hops with rich malty notes. Brown sugar with light caramel. Toffee. Finish citrusy and piny with lots of malt. Persistent piny notes with resinous bitterness. Not much alcohol. Tiny phenolic notes here and there.

Palate : Carbonation is quite soft but it suits the beer quite well. Medium palate. Quite a nice palate overall.

Overall : Really well rounded beer. Note sure why this is an english strong ale with all the american hops used. Cant figure why American Strong Ale didnt fit this. Anyhow, this is a very well balanced and well presented hoppy brown ale. Nice palate, nice balance between hops and malt, nice appearance. Not much negative stuff to say about this.

Une bouteille de 50 cl.  Batch 812.  Meilleure avant le 24.05.2016.  Un corps brun acajou et une tête qui garde la forme.  Des parfums de chocolat doux, de noisettes, de caramel fumé et de fruits foncés qui rencontrent des arômes de houblons qui proposent un mélange de terre, de feuilles et dherbes.  Solide.  Sur les papilles, des notes rôties et maltées, des houblons opportuns, des fruits, du café, des feuilles de tabac et quelques notes citriques.  Difficile de ne pas aimer.  Un corps crémeux, bien rond avec un pétillement doux.  Une finale en amertume résineuse, longue et accompagnée par un alcool qui réchauffe avec précaution.

Bouteille de 0,5litre brassée le 24.05.12 et meilleure avant le 24.05.16 batch 812 (?). Superbe robe brune orangée  avec une tête crémeuse épaisse.
