This imperial brown ale has been one of my favourites for some years. "Sølepytt"-appearance. The aroma is characterized by coffee and licorice. Tastes the same + caramel, hops and special malts. Sparkely.

Fantastic....hopped up with big chocolate and toasty malts. Great balance and good sweet roasted malt middle. The finished is mildly dry with light hop bitterness. Well balanced and super tasty overall.

Pours a deep brown with an off white head. Smells of toffee, malts and chocolate. The taste is so much more, there is toffee, some roasted malts, chocolate hints, caramel, good malty bass with a slightl hop presence. The beer seems to coat your mouth and fill every inch with flavour, leaving a malty finish. An excellent beer, a real treat.

Fingerhögt krämfärgat skum. Tydlig kakaodoft parad med rökmalt. Härlig torr smak. Välbalanserad. Den kraftiga maltsötman möter precis lagom beska. Nögne bekräftar, igen, sin ställning som kvalitetsbryggare.

Bottled 500ml. -at Brewberry, Paris. Brown coloured, medium sized beige head, caramel nose. Sweet malty, fruity and heavy caramel taste with notes of hops and spices. Also some chocolate in the background. Light bitter finish. Pleasant brew.

Bottle, traded with Palme, thanks again! Dark brown with a frothy head of very high sustain. Full blown dark malts on the nose - caramel, licorice, coffee, then some woody notes, ripe apples... and some piny-resiny hops, less assertive than expected, which works really well here. What a great, sumptuous beer this is! Full bodied, light sweet, very aromatic, with a deep, intensive flavour. Soft and smooth on the palate, coffee and chocolate aftertaste. Light warm, light bitter, peppery finish. Tasty!
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is toasted malt, caramel, and sugar. Flavour is fairly similar to aroma.
50cl. Black with lightbrown head. Chocolate and malt. Sweet with a strange yeasty choco aftert. Not great

50 cl bottle. Batch #622. Brewed on 28.04.2011. BBE 28.04.2014.
Originally rated on 20090215.
Pours deep dark ruby red color with a small and steady off-white head. Aroma of dark ripe fruits, hops, syrup, caramel, toasted malt notes, toffee, coffee, orange peel, sugar and molasses and mild biscuits.
Flavor of creamy caramel, toffee, ripe fruits, mild coffee notes, sweet malts, yeast, hops, hints of syrup and some sugar candy. Sugary and a bit sticky palate with a lingering bitter fruity finish. At times the mouth feel is a bit watery even for such a strong brew but nothing that would ruin the taste. Something is missing though compared to the first one I tasted some years ago, still very good.
5426

Bottle ruthlessly tanned up at Petes when leftover by Ben. Thanks and sorry. Pours chestnut Brown with a light brown/cream head. Aroma is straight caramel. Flavour has a lot of caramel and some spice leading towards a liquorice edge. The alcohol comes through too. Its very nice

Flaske fra Polet, batch 721 (brygget 11/11, best før 11/16). Flott beige skum. Førsteinntrykket er mørk sjokolade og solbær med mørkere og saftigere smak etter hvert som temperaturen i glasset stiger. Nydelig balansert. Vel verdt de ekstra kronene opp fra NØ Brun.
Bottle at t klooster in delft. Dark red pour with a lasting fine tan head. Candy cane sugar. Red fruits. Balanced. A nice beer.

Bottle shared at Klooster.  Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel and fruits.  Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium
Bodied with soft carbonation.
Keg at colston yard, Bristol. Quite meaty crusty bread aroma in this chestnut Brown beer. Fruity chocolate washed down with port, lots of umami and a moreish damson finish
Pours dark brown with a tan head.  Thick dark roasted malt aroma of coffee and alcohol.  Chocolate sweetness and caramel finish.  Medium body and well balanced dose of hops to tie it all together.

Pours dark brown that lets light through around the edges.  Half inch tan head.  Aroma of chewy malts, caramel, chicory, coffee.  Taste is similar, with the chicory really running the show.  Balancing bitterness.  For a big beer, this is really...restrained.  Bitterness starts to build after a while.

The best beer i have ever tasted in my life, this beer is just perfect. Sweet taste of malt, dark foam, dark brown cloady color to the beer and the taste is just amazing, tastes strong ale, very good, dark taste to it, and as you swallows, its just like getting an orgasm in your throat.

Nogne is always good. Dark brown brew with a thick, creamy light brown head with exceptional stickiness. With all the malts in this thing I figured a lengthy sit would be a smart move. Man, that payed off. Rich roasty smoke aroma, thick non-sweet caramel that smells chewy, faint deep choco milk, dull spicy hop fruit hdyfvdjdbfgcbdhjlaidf, on to the flavours. Big malts then a balanced light fruit after midway. A fluttering between the malt and more orangy stuff finishes off the taste with mild bitterness that hangs around on the sides of my licking device. The remaining pour came out if the fridge so I assume a different angle. More orange and pepper, sweeter caramel, middle of the roast-toast battle, faint almost chocolate, mild Christmas candy memories (not the ones of cigarettes being estinguished on my corneas), last throught is of orange spice mic. A bit zippy and a long yes subdued bitter lingering to go along with soft lips. Winner. Dont get your hopes up - Im not thinking about you.

Good brown body with reddish hints, a tall rocky cap floats on top. Brown ale.....is this anyones favorite style? Is it even in any ones top ten favorite styles? Aroma has cold coffee and soap, possible smoky chocolate but that seems like a stretch. Flavour is all cold coffee with a big bitter aftertaste. Some sweetness with a touch of vanilla. For a brown ale I guess its good but its a brown ale so ya.
Bottle from Vinmonopolet Storo. Pours brown to amber with a beige head. Lighty roasted aromas with fruits and caramel. Well balanced and pleasant. Nice brown ale! (2012-07-27)

500ml bottle - deep brown with nice two finger thick white head. A deep nose of molasses and rich malts and caramel, a good hit of toffee, vanilla and dark fruits, with a malty booze kick at the end to give s warm finish. One to savour.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beautifull, two-finger tanned head. Malty aroma, full of earthy notes and nuts. I did detect some dried citrus fruits as well. Flavour has a malty sweetness and dry finish. Getting a roasted character overall and a full bodied experience. Really nice, well balanced brew and very nice to drink.
Two years into three year stated shelf life.  Deep brown colour with attractive head.  Citrus hop aroma.  Big mouthfeel.  Very tasty stuff

Aroma of rich dark malts.  Caramel, chocolate, slight oakiness on the nose. Pours a rick dark nearly opaque brown nearing black with a thin dark tan head that quickly dissipates.  Sweet with a light bitterness and tinge of sour.  The mouthfeel is more watery than the color and aroma would imply.  But still nice.   More body would be a welcome addition, but the thin nature of the beer makes it very drinkable.

Bottle.  Very dark brown with a firm cream foam.  Aromas are toffee with caramel and cookie dough.  Honeycomb with spices and honey.  Light grapefruit with chocolate and sea water.  Flavours are toffee and biscuit sweet malts with gritty cocoa.  Bittersweet lemon with medicinal notes.  Herbal, earthy and spicy to finish.  Good.
Dark brown colour. Caramel toffee aroma. Similar taste, slightly sweet. Nice.

500 ml bottle from The Wine and Cheese Place. Pours an opaque dark brown with a big, frothy tan head. Aroma of toasty malts, dark chocolate, ginger and other spices, leaves, and earth. Flavor of nuts, toasted malts, earth, chocolate, bread, and cola. Medium-bodied, with medium soft carbonation and a smooth, mellow mouthfeel. Nice brown/English strong ale.

500ml bottle shared with Cyril and Romain at Fleur du Malt. Awesome beer!
Pours dark brown with 3 cm light beige head. Aroma is caramel and chocolate with some riped fruity notes. In mouth you also taste intense roastiness and some fruity hops. The creamy texture and well balanced alcohol/length make this beer a gret experience with a long finish. 
We also appreciated a lot of "Chili Con Carne" during that tasting ;-)
Cheers Mates !

500ml bottle pours dark brown color with a 2 finger light beige head that settles slowly revealing some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma is caramel and chocolate with some roasted grains and earthy notes.  Taste is roasted grain and earthy hop bitterness with some chocolate malty sweetness with the alcohol well hidden.  Medium bodied with nice carbonation leaving a pleasant tingle on the tongue.  This is an outstanding brown ale that is definitely worthy of a great tasting experience.

Not shure of the date but is probably a few years old.Has a black label with a  plain yellow 0  on it.
 Deep dark brown with a red hue.Frothy short head,creamy.
Malty carmel aroma sweet milk chocolate.Slight herbal spice Possibly cinnimon like or licorice slight clove.
Nice chewy taste,malty with chocolate,some full bodied thickness,creamy,rich,nice peppery numbing bittering.Complex maybe some floral and hoppiness behind the malt.Its really refined with the malt.Slight yeastiness.Good beer pretty rich,chewy,fairly complex.Toasty dryness in the finish,lingering spice/peppery bittering.Garlic kind of bittering burn,not intense but somewhat strong.

Dark brown, hazy(ish). Huge khaki head with a creamy top and dense large bubbles underneath. Huge aroma of coffee and chocolate. Some hop presence, but not much. Very malty, roasted coffee flavor. Some chocolate and hop notes. Very smooth, with just a tinge of bitterness on the back. Pretty darn good.

500ml bottle. Clear red glowing dark brown with average to huge firm frothy to creamy lacing off-white head. Slightly sweet malty aroma with milk chocolate and nuttily notes. Slightly sweet dark malt taste, dry overtone, nuttily notes, hint of chocolate.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Deep brown colour with a faint red hint at the bottom, solid white head. Looks awesome. Aroma is malty, toast and fruit cake. Taste is complex, lots of malt upfront but also a pleasantly bitter hop finish. Slips down well, didnt taste 7.5%. A very solid take on a brown ale, would indeed be excellent with food.

I don't have time to properly rate this beer, but it is solid. Good flavor. Smooth. Yummy.

oh baby. This is good. Thick malty richness with a nice alcohol power. I loved it.
Tap at DØE. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, chocolate, fruit, licorice and malt.

From a 500ml bottle on 20/5/2012 (batch number 652, brewed 5/7/2011, best before 5/7/2014). Pours a very dark brown with a biggish tan head. Has a moderate chocolate and caramel malt aroma. Nice.

Bottle. Pours dark deep brown black with tan head and nice light tight lace. Roast raisins choc dark malt earthy floral hops big caramel. Med body, creamy mouthfeel med light carb figs toast dark toffee. Finishes semi sweet with caramel and lingering pitted fruit notes.

500ml bottle.
Gladelig syttende Mai!!!
Pours a deep, dark copper/brown, with a beige head.
Roasted, malty aroma, coffee, chocolate, toffee, ashes, hops, dried fruits, plums.
Off-dry, medium to full body, medium bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, malty taste, roasted, chocolate, licorice, coffee, toffee, ashes, vanilla, slight acidity from the roasted malt.
Long, balanced finish, a lovely sipper. Or quaffer. (2012-05-17)
500 ml bottle at Grunerløkka Brygghus,Oslo easter 2012.Malty strong ale.I guess it would match blue cheese or the Guinness cake they serve here.

A dull style made slightly less dull by turning the amp up to 11. Still, other styles respond much more favourably to "imperialisation". This is perfectly drinkable but forgettable. Looks very much like a brown ale. Thin head but enduring. Sweet, malty aroma with some hazelnut, ginger and attic dust. The Goldings trumps the new world hops in the aroma, at least. Not very inspiring under the nose. Creamy mouthfeel. The taste doesnt deliver anything the aroma didnt promise. Dominated by sweet malts at the front of the palate. Bit of Milo chocolate in the middle and then a nice warming finish with a pinch of allspice. Too sweet for mine and not enough going on to warrant a return visit. (500ml bottle from Down Under Cellars, Leura. Batch 6222)

Draught @ Ølfestival København 2012
Aroma is somewhat light with lots of malt and hints of licorice. Flavour is malty with some licorice and dark fruits. Some alcohol in the somewhat leathery and dry finish. Not very english, but rather good.

500ml bottle. Pours a murky deep chestnut, with a smallish beige head, which lasts fairly well and leaves some lace. Rye toast, biscuit and mild coffee malt notes blend with some fresh, leafy hops on the nose. Spicy, slightly floral hops up front lead into a rich, malty body, which offers more rye toast and some fruitcake. More leafy hops keep the finish clean. A satisfying dark ale, with plenty of rich, dark malt and a good dose of hops to pep things up a bit.

Bottle 500ml from the local taphouse. Great malty strong ale. Aromas of caramel, chocolate, rum, dark fruit, oak, and cereal. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and long length. Palate is velvety, and full bodied. Brown, with a frothy head.

50 cl. bottle @ home / purchased @ Hopduvel / Bottled on 16/10/2009 / Batch 461: murky going slightly to dark berry brown with a tanned head, smells like coffee, dark fruits, berries, cocoa, chocolate, taste is sweet upfront plenty of liquorish, toffee, coffee, caramel malts, creamed dark fruits, chocolate, going into a bitter (touch hops finish), liquorish, figs, cocao, hint spices, going to soft carb. slightly grainy & touch chewy, not bad at all, needs to we warmed up, that is for sure

I find it to have a bit too much contrast between the sweet (English) malt base and the bitter (American) hops.  Then again, I drank it by itself, and I see it is recommended together with "tasteful" cheeses, which I think would be a good match.

Dark amber/brown with anoff white head - malty aroma with some caramel and chocolate - good malt body with some caramel, chcolate with some hints of dark fruits in the back nad olso some bitterness - this was nice

Bottle. Very dark, murky brown with a tall, fluffy tan head. Aroma is big chocolate, caramel, earthy hops, cocoa and soft nuttiness. Taste is big chocolate as well with more caramel notes, sweet malt, earthy notes, cocoa, dark fruit notes and soft nuttiness. Body is medium-full and chewy with a soft, bubbly carbonation. Ends with more chocolate, caramel, sweet malt, cocoa powder, chocolate covered nuts, earthy notes and dark fruit. Damn tasty!

Bottle. Poured clear dark brown color with medium light brown frothy head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Medium toasted malt and floral hop aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted malt and hop flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good interesting brew.

Bottle. Dark brown with a light tan head. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, grass, pine. Taste is sweet and a little boozy with toffee, chocolate, some spices, licorice. Finishes struggling to be dry with bitterness creeping up. Quite high carbonation. The American hop flavours jar and the malt has more power than charm, but its tasty and does indeed go well with strong cheese.

It's nutty and delicious....it's nutilicous! Great, great beer nogne I take my hat off to you.

500 ml bottle. #6222. Copenhagen, Denmark.
Dark reddish brown colour with small to average size light tan head.

Dark brown body, big off white head. Malty aroma with caramel, brown sugar and bread. Smooth, low carbonated palate. Flavour is sweet with spices, cereal, butter and caramel, with a balanced bittersweet finish. Great.

Dark colour, off-white head. A mighty malty aroma, also caramel and alcohol far back there. Very malty brown with caramel undertones. Doesnt come across as big as the name suggests, meaning the imperial notation is nicely relaxed and not in your face. Highly recommend.

Bottle. Pours lively, big frothy nut brown head, lays to a sticky covering. Aroma is citric fruit, mango, raisin, dark berries. Finishes with a spicy hop bitter kick and a creeping lip puckering dryness. Awesome, awesome beer.

Colore marrone scuro tendente al nero, con schiuma beige. Al naso tostato dominante ma anche note affumicate. Al palato tostato intenso con generosa luppolatura. Il finale è leggermente affumicato e amaro. 
 Da provare e riprovare.

This beer is pored into a pint glass and has a dark brown appearance with a tan head. The aroma to me is slightly sugar candy with nuts. I get a light coffee flavour that is slightly sweetend and finishes slightly bitter. It goes down smooth across the pallet. Overall a really good beer.

50cl bottle poured into a pint glass. Dark ruby brown with tall creamy tan head. Aroma is strong floral hops and perhaps some dark fruit. Flavor is cherries and hops. Thick mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Lasting sticky finish of cherry and hop bitterness with some nice warming booze. Very tasty brew.

500 mL bottle. Pours a clear dark brown color with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of big chocolate notes, cherries, other fruits and an earthy note. The taste is bitter herbal hops, chocolate, honey and nuts. Medium-full bodied. Fantastic Beer.

Bottle at home. Dark brown colour with small golden head. Aroma is ginger, spicy, roasty malt and bit of chocolate. Taste is very malty with a spicy edge and a touch of chocolate again. Quite full bodied, and very nice.

bottle,mybrewerytap.com. A faint sherry note ahead of some ripe vineous aromas. Depply dark ruby brown, it has traces of roast malt befores ettling into some rich fruit flavours. Some cherry & raspberry sherbert gives just a tiny hint of sourness, which really works. Inevitably a dry mouthfeel and finish from these flavours.

24/06/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Bevuta al Nøgne Ø Beer Festival. Nera, densa, con riflessi rubino, lieve cappello di schiuma bianco-sporca, appena persistente. 500 mL bottle from State Line Liquors shared at the 17th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering, 1/28/12. Pours a clear dark brown color with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of big chocolate notes, cherries, other fruits and an earthy note. The taste is bitter herbal hops, chocolate, honey and nuts. Medium-full bodied. Not quite what I was expecting... in a good way. Impressive beer.

500ml bottle. Thick brown colour with an even plateau of coffee coloured foam. When held to the light nothing comes through, solid as a bank vault. Nutty biscuity malt aromas get your attention as does the chocolate lingering in the background. There is nothing subtle about the flavours, big and brash with lots of chocolate, malt and maybe a hint of aniseed. Texturally pleasing with a full rick mouthfeel. The flavour stays long after the beer has left the mouth. All brown ales should be this good.
Deep brown, slight head, Richmond 17th.  Earthy hop aroma, roasty but not coffee malts, slight nuts.  Flavor is a match.  Not bad at all.
Sampled at the Richmond 17th Gathering. Dark brown pour with good white head. A little soy, nutty, toasty.  Cardboard.  Not that great actually.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Dark brown with Guinness like-oily head. Nose is sweet, malty and molasses. Taste is yummy caramel, toffee and plenty of malts. Has some sharp and spicy notes throughout, believe certainly that it goes well with Cheese. Well done.

On tap. Almost black with ruby haze. Nice lumpy tan head. Biscuity malts with a chocolatey licorice note. Hops are here, but not prominent. Can be tasted in the bitter palate. Lots of body. Very tasty.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a beige head that quickly collapses. Aroma roast with some pine hops. Flavour is bittersweet liqourice and dried fruit. Sweetness comes through in the finish. Excellent.
Pours dark brown, small head.  Nose is nutty with caramel notes and a hint of pine.  Taste is salty and bitter, minimal sweet.   Body is light, sharp and fizzy on the tongue.
Dark, red glow, fading off-white head. Taste is a mixture of some vanilla, roasted malts, chocolate and a bit vinous. Pretty sweet, medium carbo and ok body.

Bottled. Dark amber beer has huge, frothy head. Roasted barley and coffee notes, citrusy/peachy and grassy hops. Some metal when cold. Dry pale ale malts and toasted bread with some caramel and round wheat notes. Slightly chocolatey finish with dry bitterness. Creamy texture, medium body. A bit boring and simple beer.
Murky brown, tiny lacing. Red fruit - cherry and apple -, raisin, rye bread and leather. High alcohol, quite a lot of taste. Light tinteling body. Tasty. (At the De Molen brewery tasting.)

Bottle at monthly tasting @ De Molen. Clear brown pour, thin off-white head. Aroma is sugary, some spices, nuts and caramel. Flavor is very sweet, quite sugary, somewhat roasty, nice but a bit too sweet.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours nearly pitch black with the tiniest tints of red and a thick inviting head, that never goes away. Aroma is full of american piney and flowery english hops, and some good old malt.  Lovely. The taste is soft soft soft, caramell and licorice, malty with wonderful supporting hops.  Its a great beer, this is. The softness and sweetnes hides the alcohol all too well. But its not a brown ale by far. It smells like a porter, pours like a porter, looks like a porter and tastes like a porter.  Imperial Porter, thats what it is.
50 cL bottle from Beers of Europe into a pint glass.  Dark brown with a good creamy head.  Largely hoppy aroma, aromatic.  Well balanced, dry and nicely hopped, a very good ale.

Pours dark/black of white head. Nose of spruce hops. Refreshing aromas of dark coffee and chocolate, with a citrusy hoppy aroma, that I cant quite describe, but makes it quite balanced. Very good, balanced and refreshing.

Bottle: Hazy reddish brown beer with a frothy quickly diminishing beige head, Good lacing. Intense hard roasted malty aroma with notes of nuts, burned caramel, molasses and dried fruits. Taste is bittersweet and hard roasted with a sugary texture, full body and wonderfully integrated notes of licorice and grapefruits, probably coming from the hops. Lingering dry, medium bitter finish. Superb.

500ml bottle in a shaker.  Pours very deep brown with a lacy head.  Aroma of strong caramel and nutty malts, a little bit roasted, some coffee notes, and light hops.  Flavor the same.  Smooth texture.  A really good beer.

In bottiglia da P P Ale di Roma. Colore marrone scuro tendente al nero, schiuma beige. Al naso tostato dominante ma anche note affumicate, al palato tostato intenso, generosa luppolatura, finale leggermente affumicato, amaro. Corpo medio, carbonatura perfetta.
Da provare e riprovare.

Pours a nice chocolate brown with a creamy tan head. Smells of sour fruits. Taste in this beer is of nutty, woody, caramel and a slight booze finish with a nice aftertaste. Good mouth-feel. Good beer.

16.9 oz bottle.  Clear purple brown with a smooth beige head.  Nose is butterscotch and fig fading to dusty coffee.  Chewy, fluffy with a prickly buzz.  Taste is toffee, some burnt sugar, black grape and earthy hops.  Evolves as it warms; quite nice.

Bottle at Galbraiths Alehouse (Auckland, NZ), courtesy of Dave. All about the malt palate and complexity. Roasty and nutty at first, and then a touch of sweetness, spice and tartness in the finish. Seems wrong that it is only 7.5%, as has flavour you would expect from something a lot bigger.

Bottle @ Dans house. Hazy dark brown/black appearance with a light brown head. Big roasty, nutty, malty, slightly charred, a touch smoky, herbal aroma. Huge toasty, slightly burnt, charred, roasty dark malty, moderately nutty, grassy/herbal/piney hoppy flavor. Roasty, a touch smoky aftertaste.

500 ml bottle. Deep dark reddish brown colour, medium-sized light tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee, with some dark fruits and smoky notes. The flavour is roasted malty, with coffee and chocolate, and notes of smoke. Roasted, ashy, hoppy-bitter finish. Very tasty.

A little nutty, caramel, and grain aroma. Some almond. Flavor is smooth, a little roasty, and slightly sweet closer to the finish. The nuttiness comes through again here. Pretty nice. Pretty drinkable. The alcohol and bigger presence work well for this style of beer.

Bottle from Dodgy Deli, Cowley Road, October 2011 consumed 1st December 2011 at home   Dark brown in colour with a tan head. Decent malty beer, some cocoa and chocolate flavours but also a little tangy fruit, Nice.  A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov14   3.4

Bottle from TWCP.  Almost black and thick looking with a tan head.  Tons of malt in the nose with dark fruit, molasses, and cocoa.  The flavor mimics that.  The malt is huge here but the flavor is not quite as complex as the nose.  Cocoa and toasted notes with softer fruit.  Late some alcohol comes through but it is not over done.  Bitterness is minimal.   Preferring sweet and malty beers, this one is in my wheelhouse.
Aroma of roasted malt and licorice with lovely fresh hop notes. Good taste of roasted malt, salt licorice, wheat and hops. The aftertaste is slightly dry. Really nice and tasty beer.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget
Brygget 050711, best føre 050714 - Pours dark brown with a large light brown head. Aroma has notes of slightly roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, smoke and wood. Taste is sweet, malty and hoppy with notes of chocolate and coffee. Hints of spices and smoky ash as well. Finish is slightly roasty and bitter. Nice, well balanced and hoppy brown ale.

Kan väl nästan kallas för brown IPA. Mörkt maghognyfärgad med kompakt lågt skum. Stor men rund och snäll blommig humledoft. Finstämt, välbalanserat, smakrikt som vanligt av Nögne.

Bottlem pour dark brown/red with medium off white head. Aroma is caramel, nuts, smoke. some citrusy and fruity hops. Some coffee. Taste is sweet with some late bitterness. Medium body,  average carbonation. long finish. Liked it
Bottle. Pours Brown with a small brown head. Smells smoky malty and tastes very smoky with a similar finish.

Pours dark brown. Lots of slightly tan head. Lightly roasted malt nose, some alcohol and some red fruit. Roasted malt, but not burnt, red fruit and alcohol aroma. Very good, but a bit to much alcohol when it gets to warm (ie. the bottom of the glass).

Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a dark brown-black liquid with a reddish tint. Also a big light brown head. Smell is deep with with chocolate, some nuts and also a hint of coffee. Is that some grassy hops in the background? Rich taste of coffee, dark bread and chocolate. Very musty and nice. Also thick body and smooth mouth feel with a low to average amount of carbonation. A very nice beer.

Aroma: American hops, roasted malts, alcohol. 
Appearance: brown colour, small beige head. 
Flavour: Brown ale on steroids, fruity American hops blending with nutty and roasted notes from the malts, reminds me a bit of Mikkeller Jackie brown. 
Mouthfeel: Average, lively
Total: As always a fine quality brew from Grimstad.

pours brown to black with high frizzy head
distinct aromas of coffe,oranges, chocolate, some tar
sweet and quite oaky felling to it. coffee and dark chocolate is there. some bitterness stays in the mouth. medium body some alcohol feeling to it. overall a quite good beer.
Dark brown of color with a beige head. An aroma of roasted malt, coffee and caramel. A flavor of roasted malt, bitter and caramel.
Bottle. Dark brown with a medium head.Nutty and malty with a hoppy background. From that description you can see that its quite a complicated beer. Different and impressive.

Bottle. Dark brown, cloudy, average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, caramel and light roasted malt, fruitiness and some piney hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish, caramel - light toffee and roasted malt, light piney hoppyness and fruitiness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, caramel and some roasted malt, some piney hoppyness. aramel sweetish brown ale with nice hoppyness.

Keg at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a lovely deep brown, finger of whitish head. Aroma is lovely, caramel, hops, booze, a little tomato juice. Taste is lovely, great flavour from the hops, some caramel, a little Milka chocolate. Good and earthy, with a more bitter finish than Id expected. A little dry. Lovely. In a dimly lot bar, teamed with Nughthawks At The Diner by Tom Waits, its nigh on perfect.

Bottle.
Dark brown with a large tan to light brown head.
Aroma: fruity, lightly roasted, hazel nuts.
Taste: roasted hazel nuts, malty, earthy bitterness, some citrus, some chocolate, licorice and some kind of candy.
Above medium body and carbonation.

Varenda kvadratcentimeter av ens njutningscentra fylls upp av det här ölet. Ingenting antyds, allt textas med stora bokstäver och förstärks som genom en megafon (en smaklökarnas hörapparat?). I för stora mängder riskerar sinnena att krokna och bli alltför dästa, men rätt doserat är det en försmak av det överjordiska.
En mycket angenäm ölupplevelse, bra balanserad och en härlig maltighet och mjuk som sammet. Det bör tilläggas att detta var en berusad recension.

Keg at Brewdog Bar Aberdeen. It pours hazy dark brown, with a thick beige head. The nose is chocolate, smoke, bonfire, wood and cheddar. The taste is sweet caramel, toffee, Scottish tablet, hazelnut syrup, herbal, pepper, liquorice, chocolate and brown sugar, with a dry woody-hop finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Decent, but I greatly prefer the Kernel Imperial brown.
Tap at brewdog. Pours murky brown with tab head. Caramel fruity aroma. Nutty caramel taste, some hops. Oily heavy with a bitter finish. Pretty good

Bottle 50 cl, SB. Pours pitch black with a huge creamy tanned head leaving lacing. Aroma is roasted malty, slightly smokey, fresh dark bread, caramel, ashy, pears and apricots. Crispy mouthfeel. Flavor is roasted, very malty, fruity, bitter, hoppy and chocolate. Finishes longlived malty and bitter.

Waited for 1/2 hour while finishing the meal - and then it ws totally different and with a more softer milk chocolate aroma... 3,9 points instead of 3,7!

Bottle from SB Majorna cons 2011-09-18 Göteborg
AR: soya, roasted malt , vanilla, moon-shine, chocolate-liqure
AP: deep dark brown colored body, high, high  wee bubbly head that is quickly deminishing into a guiness stouty head
F: stouty - like alcholic infused guiness, roastel malt, round body, milk chocolate bar, medium bitterness, loaded with carbonation

Brown bottle, 0,5 l, batch 492, bottled on 220310, best before 220313, via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savoured on September 15 2011; eye: dark brown, opaque, no effervescence, beige head that turns into a tiny ring, light lacing; nose: nutty, light roasted malt, light molasses, light dark chocolate, malt; mouth: roasted malt, lots of malt, alcohol, alcohol warmth,  roasted malt molasses, hops that comes out of nowhere, finale in molasses with presence of alcohol warmth, full body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 0,5 l, lot 492, embouteillée le 220310, meilleure avant 220313 via Importations Privées Bièropholie (merci Hughes!), savourée le 15 septembre 2011; il : brune foncée, opaque, pas deffervescence, mousse beige qui se transforme en un petit anneau, légère dentelle; nez : noix, léger malt torréfié, léger mélasse, léger chocolat noir, malt; bouche : malt torréfié, beaucoup de malt, alcool, chaleur dalcool, malt torréfié, mélasse, houblon qui sort de nulle part, finale en mélasse avec présence de chaleur dalcool, corsé, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

50cl bottle. Pours a chestnut colour with definite shades of toffee near the bottom of the glass. The nose has ginger nut biscuits going into toffee. 
The taste has more tangy spiced biscuits and it finishes on a big note of hay. The palate is big in structure with a creamy but at the same time tangy texture through the mid-palate. The finish is clean and tangy much like a bitter in fact. Overall, I like this a lot but for the first time (having now had 11 of their beers) I dont actually think this is true to the style. This to me is more like some sort of Imperial Bitter if such a thing exists. Its tasty though.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on September 10. Pours a deep brown and fizzy liquid with a big beige head. Smells sweet of dark bread but theres also a hoppy freshness. Taste is sweet and fullbodied with a noticable bitterness. There is also a warm taste of alcohol to it. ----- Had this with some Chèvre and Gorgonzola and this really mixed well with the different cheeses. Can very much recommend serving this beer with tasty cheese.

Bottle, 50cl. Pours dark brown with a large, light brown head. Sweet aroma of alcohol, toffee, caramel and chocolate, a bit nutty. Flavour is dominated by alcohol, some citrus and dark malts. Medium body/bitternes. I had higher hopes for this one. Vaskad...

Pours dark brown with a large off-white head. The smell is rich with the focus on coffee and chocolate. The taste is equally rich with coffee, chokolate, plumps in brandy, light acidity, wood and more that I cant out my finger on. Altogether a very nice brown ale
Sep 11. No particular head but nice dark coloured. Has a fresh smell. Taste is well balanced with roasted coffebeans as ground it makes an abrupt finish.

Bottle 500ml. A clear light brown colour with a high, beige-brown head. An aroma of malt, caramel and alcohol. Some roasted and burned notes. A medium sweet and medium bitter taste. A full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long finish. I like this brown ale a lot.

On keg at Bacchus, Newcastle. Pours a cloudy, dark brown colour with a thick, light tan head. Aroma of dried fruits, raisins, plums, caramel, chocolate and bready yeast. Big hoppy flavour upfront, fruity with notes of passion fruit, pineapple and mango. Backbone of chocolate and dark malts. Foamy mouth-feel with a little CO2 prickle. Nice.
Dark opaque brown colour with a good head which disappears completely after a few minutes. Aromas of hops, malt and toffee.  Tastes bitter, and a bith earthy.  Sour after taste.
Pours brown with a brown head. Aroma is nutty, caramel, light roasted malts and light chocolate. Taste add some weak hops and a bit of liquorice. Pretty good.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2011 The aroma is nutty, chocolatey, earthy.  The appearance is deep brown, off-white head.  The flavor is brown sugar, nuts, big chocolate.  Medium in body.  The finish is sweet, brown sugar, leading to enduring piney hops.  Very solid Brown Ale.  Not worth the $14/32 oz growler I paid for this, but solid.

Pours a deep brown color with a small well retained head and some lace. The aroma is nutty with some earthy and chocolaty notes some mild pear and alcohol show through as well. The flavor is really fairly bitter but also nutty with some woodiness and a good dosage of earthy hops. The beer is decidedly not sweet but allows some room for a balance of sweet nuttiness. Pretty tasty stuff.

Bottle at home.
Clear brown color with a light-brown head, nice lacings. Aroma moderate to heavy malty (roasted, burnt, caramel, chocolate, licorice). Flavor moderate to heavy sweet, moderate bitter. Body medium to full, oily, soft carbonated.

Bottle. A hazy dark brown beer, with a small, frothy, fully lasting beige head. The aroma is moderately malty and lightly hoppy, with notes of caramel, chocolate, toasted/roasted nuts, flowers, dark fruits, with a touch of brown sugar. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium to full body, velvety texture, average/lively carbonation, long finish with medium bitterness and a light alcoholic touch. Very good, malty, balanced beer, with good clean bitterness. Excellent, genuine and complex aroma, with more than decent mouthfeel. High quality as normal from Nogne O.

Bottle, courtesy of gunnfryd.Pours brown with a big tan head.Aroma of toaste and roasted malt, hay, chocolate and some dark berries.Flavor is sweet with some sour notes and some roasted notes.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice brown ale.

Bottle. Dark brown, thin tanned head that leaves some lacings. Aroma of chocolate, toffee, caramel and wood. Taste is quite malty with good sweetness, dominated by roasted malts. Much chocolate here to, also some coffee. Feel is oily and corbanation is lively and pricky. Finish has good hops and nice bitterness.

500 ml bottle @ Bishops Arms, Bellmansgatan, Stockholm. Batch #237, brygget 12.03.2006, BBE 12.03.2011. Rated @ 23.5.2011.
Pours a dark reddish brown colour with a light brown head on the edges. Aroma of dried fruits, syrup and some lovely citrus. Flavour of toasted malts, syrup, dried fruits, mild chocolate, nuts and ripe raisins. Medium/full bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a fruity, raisiny finish. This has aged very well and its just awesome. Im glad that I still managed to found a such aged bottle.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with a beige, creamy and lacing head. Nose of toasted malts and brown sugar. Flavour of chocoklate, coffee, nuts and with caramel notes. Creamy texture, flat carbonation and full bodied. Ends up mor dry with at little malt bitterness and alcohol. More like a stout but very nice indeed.

Brown colour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and nuts. Flavor is malty and sweet, with american hops in the background, lightly roasted, caramel, chocolate, citrus and nuts. Smooth and well balanced.

The body is hazy dark brown with a red tint and has a small, light-brown head that fairly quickly reduces to a thin layer, with additional foam along the rim. Excellent lacing. The aroma is toasted, dark chocolate, coffee and some wonderful hoppy components. Great! The flavours are mainly the same toasted notes, but also raisins and alcohol. Maybe a bit too much alcohol? The taste is light sweet and light bitter, with a moderate bitter ending. Medium to full body, soft carbonation and oily texture. Good stuff!

[50 cl bottle, batch 600, Vinmonopolet, Grønland Basar, Oslo]

Shared bottle at BrewDog. Very dark brown, almost black with lighter highlights round the edge. Roasty malts and light chocolate on the nose. Lots of coffee too, but not in a stouty way. Taste is full and rich, notes of coffee grounds and burnt toast but never venturing into stout territory. Finish is sweet rather than bitter, but long-lasting and rich. A really drinkable, interesting beer.

About a year old bottle, at Pitchers, Falun. Pours a beautiful black with a light brown head. Chocolate flavours dominate but there is still some citrusy hops in this one, with a bitter ending. A nice variation of different roasty and fruity flavours going on. Medium body.
Very malty, as expected.  This doesnt per say taste like an imperial, apart from a slight alcohol kick to it, but it is a very good brown ale.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Tan head. Nose and taste of nuts, almond toffee, caramel malt and light hops. Smooth. Very tasty. A bit thin for an imperial.

Pours with a very dark, somewhat amber color, culminating in a tall and resilient tan head that laces very well. The aroma is wonderful: dark chocolate, coffee roasted malts, caramel. The medium-textured mouthfeel is accompanied by a complex array of flavors that match the aroma profile. While this beer style is sometimes rather boring in taste, Nøgne Øs hop selection really makes this a first-rate beer, and somewhat memorable at that.

24 March 2011 - bottle at Brewdog Bar Edinburgh. dark brown, clear, lots of bubbles. nice roasted malt aroma, dark chocolate and some alcohol. med body, slightly thin, mostly flat, slightly oily. tastes of coffee with milk, non-bitter molasses, some vanilla or chocolate chip cookies w/out chips. amazing how higher abv improves a brown ale!

18.03.2011. 0,5l Bottle. Vinmonopolet Haugesund. This is my beer rating number 1000!!! Congratulations!. Dark brown colour, almost black. Brown head. Dark roasted malts with dry bitter hops. Notes off dry dark chocolate and coffee. Rich body with complex flavours. Aftertaste is dry bitter with lots of flavour.

[500ml bottle at BrewDog Bar, Edinburgh] Blackish brown pour with a cream-coloured head. Strong aromas of caramel and toffee. Quite sweet on the palate at first, before the alcohol warmth comes though. Plenty of malts on the finish, the alcohol combines to give an almost bourbon feel  but not quite  this is a tremendous malty imperial brown [15032011]

0.5L bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. Mild gusher. Batch 492.
App.:  Deep brown-black with a decent light mocha head.
  
Aroma:  Really nice cocoa, dark chocolate, some tangy fruity notes, a bit of molasses and licorice, more tangy fruit (borderline infection?), some black coffee, hints of minty herbals fighting to be smelled, a dusty/musty/earthy note, some dark dried fruits, a bit messy.
  
Palate:  Medium-full body, fairly lax effervescence, nearly still but not flaccid.
  
Flav.:  Dark chocolate, inky malts, plenty of bright fruitiness to contrast but not to overwhelm, some vague cola-like notes, molasses and a little licorice, a touch of alcohol, not excellent, but pretty big; somewhat sweet with decent bitterness and a smooth, chocolate and dark malt finish with some leafy hops.

I suspect that something is a bit off here.  Between the gushing and the bright, tangy notes, maybe a little infection?

Dark, uncloudy bron colour.
Aroma is very rich, sweet malt. Raisin and milk chocolate.
Very rich in flavour, big malt fruityness. It´s more of a porter than a brown ale, alittle high on the alcohol in the back.
Summary; I would not call this a brown ale, I would call it delicious!

Had this one at Håndverkerstuene in Oslo toguether with a norwegian roast of reindeer. Pours very dark brown, almost black. Brown and timid head. Nice aroma of malts, raisins and far notes of coffee. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness, hints of caramel and vanilla followed with notes of chocolate and coffee. Full body, creamy, soft carbonation and a long lasting sweet and bitter after taste toguether with that coffee touch. Very good.

0.5l bottle. Pours a near black/dark brown body with a thin off white head leaving big lacing. You can really smell the sweet roasted malts when you pop the cap. Also aromas of sweet vanilla and caramel. Otherwise not to brutal nose. Medium to full-bodied and medium carbonated. Nice and smooth mouthfeel. Tastes quite sweet with a nice big roasted lasting aftertaste. Hints of chocolate, dried fruits and mild coffee. Not complicated at all. Just plain old good, and really easy to drink. Almost scary easy to drink thats how good this is.

500ml Bottle (OConnors, Uppsala) - Dark brown with a foamy head. Chocolatey and roasted aroma with marzipan, soapy hops and coffee detected. Roasted and hoppy taste with notes of chocolate, roasted malt, brown sugar and nuts.

Pours a fairly clear dark brown with red hue and average tan head which leaves good lacing. Aroma is caramel, nuts, bit of citrus. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, thin to oily, average carbonation, lasting bitter fihish.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a very dark brown with a medium tan head. Good lacing. Aromas of burnt caramel, wood, nutmeg and heavy macadamia. Flavours of coffee, citrus, nuts, raisins and typical nuttiness. Very good brown ale. On the heavier side of brown ales and worth a shot for sure
Bottle from stateline.  One of those beers you find hidden in the corner in the cellar.  Not good super oxidized, cheesy hops

Nose is dark, almost sour-burnt caramel, weak sweet malt, acidic coffee, wood, cane sugar, feel is watery, carb is medium, taste is heavy caramel, earthy notes, some bitter hops, then elegant malty finish.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2013 Tried on several occasions. A fantastic Brown Ale. Pours dark brown with a firm head. Had some problems with a over-carbonated batch, but havent had that problem in over a year. Nice sweet and roasted flavor. A perfect ale by itself or to pair with cheese.

Flaske: Mystisk denne øl ikke er klassificeret som en brown ale i betragtning af at 9% stouts rask væk bliver klassificeret som stouts :) Nåh mørkebrun øl med et tæt skumhoved. Dejlig duft af karamel og en god tand chokolade og kaffe. Lidt mere af det hele, men umiskendelig en brown ale. Lækker balance med humlen. Virkelig en dejlig øl.
(Bottle 02/02-11) Batch #492. Dark brown with large light brown head. Very nice full bodied taste.

Clear dark red brown with a light brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, raosted malt, heavy malty and sweet. Flavor is very sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied and soft. The finish holds a little alcohol. Very nice. 020211

Bottle bacth 492 with another logo!. Sweet roasty coffee-caramel aromas with strong brown appearance with a medium head. The sweet malty taste is combined with a dry not dominant hobby feeling. The alcohol finish is pretty short but fine. A good beer you can drink a lot of :)

From Salling, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 150111.
Dark brown with beige head, Aroma of malt and spices. Flavor with nuts, caramel and hops. Nice palate and well hidden alcohol.
Tasted 2011-01-11. Pours dark brown (very dark) with light brown head. Aroma: hops, roasted nuts, coffee. Taste: slightly salty, quite bitter finish. Goes very well with liquorice.
Brown pour with some light tan head. Fruit and nut malty aromas. Fruit forward and some light bubblegum and sweet malt tones flavor wise. Only a touch of warming.
Bottle, pours dark brown on a short compact head. Aroma of hops and malt in a delicious mix. Taste is dominated by malt, roasted. Great beer :)

@Rudolph Throwdown-thanks to Blazer06-500ml bottle-pours a tan head ad brown color.  Aroma is medium malt, earthy.  Taste is medium malt-rosty/cocoa/peat, spice hops.  Good carbonation.  Very drinkable.

Bottle (dregs) Vero Beach GET YOUR RUDOLPH ON Throwdown Cloudy brown ale with a small, creamy, taupe head. The nutty aroma offers notes of chocolate cake batter and vanilla. Medium to full-bodied with nearly expired carbonation. The flavor is of bittersweet chocolate-covered candied nuts. Bittersweet, mocha finish.  Thanks to Blazer06 for popping the top on this one!
50 cl bottle. Murky dark brown with big foamy beige head. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, toffee, liquorice and hops.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep brown, deep deep reddish hue, huge frothy light beige head, nice lacing. &nbsp Malty nose, pale biscuit, a little barnish and musty. &nbsp Perhaps even a bit earthy. &nbsp Nice smooth malt background is the first thing I notice. &nbsp Pale toasty malts, smidgen of earth and mustiness. &nbsp Not as meaty and mealy as American Examples, and less hoppy, none of which works. &nbsp This one works. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp It tiz fairly smooth. &nbsp Lingering toasted maltiness. &nbsp Pretty straight forward, low on hops, big on malts, smooth, without being astringent or overly hoppy. &nbsp I say do away with Brown Ale and only do Imperial Brown Ale. &nbsp I dont know if those guys from Nogne Ø could do wrong.
A really nice beer to drink especially after dinner instead of desert. This is probably my favourite so far of the ones I have tried from Nøgne Ø....but I look forward to try more!!

Bottle and draft.  Pours an amber bruin body with an off white head.  Roast y body with a hint of tobacco.   Light chewy and roast y caramel and burnt coffee notes.  Dark and roast y with a lightly nutty finish.  Decent.
bottle at musa ... huge bubbly tan head .... sweet cola roast malt ... little meaty nose ... sweet toffee malts ... dark fruits ... lots of brown sugers ... litttle tofffee
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes of nuts, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts, brown sugar, chocolate and a little coffee.

Doftmässig är den inte så stor, men smaken är fylld med härliga nötter, rostat kaffe, frukt och en svag sötma. Vätskan är fyllig utan att bli för oljig. Skummet är gräddigt och fint.
En absolut stabil öl från Nøgne.

From notes.  Tasted from bottle at Lush Roscoe.  Pours clear deep amber with a thick tan head that displays excellent retention.  The nose is roasted malt with a hint of brown sugar sweetness.  The flavor is somewhat sweet with roasted malt, brown sugar, dark chocolate, and coffee.  The body is medium with average carbonation and a long roasted finish.

Bottle.
Pours dark brown with tan head.
Very chocolaty aroma.
Taste of rather sweet chocolate, hops and some red wine.

Bottle from Oak Tree. Pours dark brown with a foamy 3 finger tan head. Dark fruit aromas. Fresh dark fruit. Plummy? Full bodied with foamy carbonation. Flavor is dark brown malt, with some fresh dark fruit, and a little coffee. Its not sweet, and theres a fair amount of hop bitter. A very good beer.

Pours black with a large light tan head.
Nose shows lots of nutty and softly roasted malt along with spicy, earthy and slightly resinous hops. Later on some chocolate and diacetyl enters. Very gentle, nothing harsh or aggressive, quite well done.
Flavours show more roasted character but this quickly subsides into nutty malt and dark chocolate only to resurface in the finish as a pleasant roasty bitterness. Again, very well executed without twisting the style to much.
Moderately low carbonation works well.
Halfway between a stout and a porter really.

500 ml bottle at VilleValla Pub. Dark brown colour with big, foamy, brown head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts and some american hops. Taste is bitter with notes of chocolate. Full body with an oily mouthfeel. Pleasant overall.
At the taphouse. Dark brown pour. Big head. Nice chocolate, nutty flavours going on. Notable hop balance. Really easy drinking. Become a lot more interesting once the temperature increased.
on tap at local taphouse, darlinghurst. pours quite dark. aroma is slightly nutty. flavour is chocolate and sweet caramel, with a nutty, butterscotch smoothness. enjoyed this one a lot.

50cl bottle pours a translucent, deep nut brown with a creamy, white head.  Nutty aroma, honey, brown sugar, light coffee, toffee, multigrain bread.  Flavor is sweet, brown sugar, caramel, toffee, cookies.  Full bodied, sweet finish.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2014 pours a dark muddy brown.  semi-thick head.  feel is medium bodied.  full flavor and aroma of bready malts and a generous portion of hops.  flavor balanced between sweet malt and bitter hops.  pretty good, but far from their best.

Medium darker beige head over brown beer with orange sides. Chocolate aroma, but with a creamy touch, nearing praliné, and again (as the Brun) something sourish-woody. Dry, chocolate, cacao, agian praliné, moccha. Sweetish-sourish in the finish, yet dry. Warming up, just a hint at alcohol/spirit develops. Medium bodied at best, sharpish finish, but slightly empty. Nice, if utterly unspectacular.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting.
Body is dark brown.

Aroma is moderately malty (caramel, toasted nuts/bread, milk chocolate), lightly hoppy (herbs, flowers, apricot), with light notes of spruce and passion fruit.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

A solid, clean, fun beer.  Nutty, bready malts out front that Id have guessed was punched up with hazelnut extract, but apparently not.  Very well-attenuated, perhaps even a tiny bit too much...the mouth experience is just a hair less rich than I expected/wanted...the initial sweetness pretty much vanishes after you swallow...thats good for quaffing, but at 7.5% its not exactly a quaffing sort of beer.  Still, erring on the dry side is way better than erring on the syrupy sweet side, so thats a minor complaint.  Good stuff.

500mL. Poured a clear, deep ruby/brown with a massive brown head. Very good retention and lace. Big aroma of coffee, caramel, dark fruits, milk chocolate. Taste is bitter cardboard, olives, hummus dip, salty, thin. Off-putting. Very odd.
500 ml bottle at DC local tasting.  Brown color, small tan head.  Aroma is caramel.  Taste is rather plain.  Needs more complexity.

Pours hazy dark brown with a huge, creamy tan head that exploded over the rim of the glass without much of a violent pour, has great retention and leaves a huge, thick sheet of lacing. Aroma is full of roasted nuts, sweet malt, caramel, creme brule, chocolate and a touch of earth. Flavor is roast, chocolate, roasted nuts, roasted nuts, golden floury biscuits, autumn leaves and a touch of lactose. Palate is medium bodied, syrupy and a little slick on entry, lightly carbonated and slightly chalky and dry to the finish. Good stuff, not great, looks awesome though.

500ml bottle bought at VInmonopolet Tromsø. Batch nr: 492. This Imperial Brown Ale has a dark beige longlasting head. Dark body, almost black. Tastes of coffecaramel/coffecream, chocolate, roast and mocca. I also detect a smoky aftertaste. Rich on taste and has a nice aroma, thus drinking this is a enjoyment from A-Z. I must say this is one of the best of its kind I have tasted so far.

500 ml. bottle. Pours a thick mocha, long lasting head (reminiscent of a nitro pour), over a brown (SRM 30) hazy, particle laden body......nose is coffee, toffee/caramel, cereal....taste is cereal, light coffee, toffee/caramel, finish is lingering malty richness, with very light bitter tinges.....mouth feel is thick, rich, chewy, carbonation adds a creamy texture. This is a excellent big Brown Ale. It has all of the nose, flavor and mouth feel one could want. A question, since the brewery calls it an Imperial Brown, why is it listed as an English Strong, rather than a Brown Ale?? BJCP 7/3/15/5/7
caramel, nuts, chocolate, butterscotch, brown, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, creamy, medium body, long finish,

1 Pt .9 fl oz  Bottle. Poured a dark mahogany with a small off-white head. Aroma: chocolate, coffee, mild roasted malts, notes of smoke. Taste was much the same but also had some passing notes of fruit... more smoke than the aroma too. Medium to full body. Nice finish with just a hint of bitterness. Overall a very good brew. This beer smells & tastes like a solid Stout/Imperial Porter... not what I was expecting when I bought the bottle but still a very good brew.

500ml bottle. Pours a dark brown body with a beige, creamy head. Aroma of coffee, brown sugar and mocha. Taste of dark chocolate, roasted nuts and coffee. Bitterness that sticks to the back of the tung. Long aftertaste with traces of  coffee cream.
Bottle. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee and a bit of smoke. Unclear dark brown colour with beige head. Flavour of chocolate, malt and coffee with and elegant finish of smoke and hops.

Nogne O
Imperial Brown Ale
Pours brown with a reddish hue. Medium off white head and medium retention. No lacing. Smoky aroma with a hint of grape jelly (so says the wife). Roasted malts with some coffee accents. Flavor-wise, this approaches a smoked porter or bigger stout with lots of roasted malts. Personally, it falls short of something. Hops are there, but something else lacks. Could be better.

50cl bottle.  Medium beige head atop murky cola brown body with dead yeasties at the bottom.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, some nut, cola, milk chocolate.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some nut, earthy.  Medium-full body, some stickiness.
On tap at Rattle N Hum.  Pours a ruby hued brown with a large beige head.  Soft toffee and caramel.  Smooth chocolate and light and subtle malts.  Caramel, soft chocolate.  Light dry hoppy finish.
On tap at Rattle.  Pour is a dark brown with wet lacing. Sweet caramel, cereal malts.  Some spruce in the background. Nice
Bottle sampled at SIB, pours dark brown. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, nuts, and some chocolate notes.
Black with a creamy off white head.  Malty citrus aroma and taste with sharp chocolate notes and a nutty finish.

Sampled on 6/18/2010. This English Strong Ale pours a dark brown color from a .5l bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head with decent lacing. The aroma is fruity, nutty and sweet, with a touch of alcohol. Medium to full bodied English Strong Ale. The malts are fruity, nutty and sweet. The hops are herbal and earthy. Nice balance. Good carbonation. A touch of tea. Nice sipping beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Bottle from Smittys.  Turbid burnt sienna pour with nose of malt, hops, toffee, brown sugar, nuts.  Tastes malty, very hoppy, with nut, brown sugar, very complex, very well balanced, with a pretty dense mouthfeel.  Delcious, and one of the top 5 brown ales I have ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2011 6/10/10. On tap at Spuyten Duyvil. Similar to their IPAs hops. Dish soap. Nutty. A bit of coffee. Bready finish. Similar to Jai Alai.  7/4/7/4/14 - 3.6

8/1/11. Bottle w/ CanIHave4Beers. Nice malty brown ale-basically a bigger moose drool, with a bit of a wheaty flavor. Dirty malt flavor, very dirty, and not in a good way. 7/4/7/3/15 -3.7

Bottle.

Lovely creamy foam and a pleasant aroma of dried fruit, nuts, toffee, coffee and hints of citrus.

The taste was pretty sweet with chocolate, roasted malt, "milk", some grass and vanilla. Nice balance, nice bitterness. Creamy and thick mouth feel, very pleasant to drink. Another solid beer from Norwegian Nøgne. 

As usual exemplary information on the bottle in terms of manufacturing date. Batch 461, brewed 161009.
Dark brown color with a quickly falling medium head.  Light chocolatey aroma.  Very minerally taste.  Some light, dry grainy notes and a bit nutty.  Thick mouthfeel.  Oddly lacking in flavor.

Pours deep, deep brown, almost opaque with a lasting light brown head. Nose is very malty. Has some orange, caramel and grain. Very very malty nose. The taste is very malty as well with caramel, orange, some sweetness and the bitterness in the after taste is more malty than hoppy. Small to medium body, medium duration. Not my kind of beer, this one is too malt dominated for me.
Pours dark brown color with khaki head. Toasted malt aroma with some tobacco. Flavors of toasted malts and nuts with a slight ashyness. Medium body with average carbonation.

Thin dissipating head.  Nose is roasty with bready backbone. Smells like a cup of coffee.  Great use and balance of roasted malts.  You are first met with a sweetness, then a bit of alcohol that is soon covered by the roasted malts.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2010 50cl, Norwegian brewery, from De Hopduvel Gent, not complex brew, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2010 Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Batch 461.
Almost an inch of head. Deep brown, ruby-red color.
Smells like caramel and fruit.
Medium body, creamy and nice.
Quite bitter taste, with hints of grass, coffee and licorice. Hints of citrus. Cant remember it tasting like this the previous time I had it, but tonight I have a slight cold, so my taste sense might be impaired. A tiny bit too bitter for my taste tonight. Slight pinch of alcohol in the aftertaste.

Extra rating 2010-04-10: 50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Batch 403, bottled 2008-12-15, purchased 2010-03-13, drunk & rated 2010-04-10. A gusher - difficult to get it to settle in a glass! But when it finally does its a very dark brown brew with a giant head (3 cm at least). The smell is sweet and nutty. The taste is quite bitter, with a full body and a pleasant balance. The aroma is full of nuts, with roasted malts and a tiny hint of soap(?). Paired with some parmesan cheese, it becomes very soft, creamy and reveals a beautiful vanilla edge! I tasted a bottle of the same batch about a week ago and noted pretty much the same aromas: nuts, vanilla, malt, some coffee&leather.

bottle.  pretty dark for for a brown with lots of fine, slow moving bubbles with a creamy tan head.  the hops almost completely cover the nutty malts.  lots of orange in aroma.  flavor is kind of a mix of three different styles to me.  a stout, a brown, and a 2ipa.  im getting confused....but who cares?...its really good.
Bottle. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich with nuts, caramel, roast malt, chocolate and notes of coffee.

Fantastic deep brown colour. The nose is sweet, with nuts and chocolate. Tastes absolutely superb! Hazelnuts, chocolate and port, with a silky smooth finish. Totally balanced, the sweetness and the restrained bitterness complement each other perfectly. This is an awesome food beer. Loved it.

pours deep brown with a creamy offwhite/tan head. Nose is cheese, damp wood, cheese is specifically pecerino, orange rind, cracked black pepper, and some chocolate notes that are subtley mixed in there as well. Taste is bitter orange rind, thick cheddary notes. I really want to just have this with a big hunk of cheddar or blue. Aghhhhhh. some chocolate, long finish.
I can see that this beer was engineered for this purpose. Nøgne are geniuses. For serious.

20100216 500ml bottle from State Line. Hazed dark caramel color with large tan head, mostly lasting. Aroma is fairly sweet with maple, pecan, white grape notes creating a soft juxtaposition to the woodsy and earthy hops. Body is luxurious, silky, almost fluffy, and despite my brain insisting that this beer should be sweet, its just not. Rather it is nicely balanced with I think a sturdy malt across the middle which is suitably not whisked away too quickly by drying hops, but slowly fading to dryness as a spiced cookie might. Flavor adds those subtle spice cake notes, gingerbread, graham, and some fruity hints of caramelized pineapple. Also find toasty nuts, sweet cashew, butterscotch, cider must. Interesting beer that I quite enjoyed even though I was fully prepared to be underwhelmed.

Bottle.  Pours a deep, dark, chestnut to cola brown color.  A tall, spongy head of khaki tinted foam settles slowly, leaving dense sheets and clumps of lacing in its wake.  The nose is an odd character, showing loads of the requisite barley roast and dry cocoa, accompanied by a strangely herbal, leafy green element.  Hints of coffee and chicory are also present, as is a slight waft of tobacco.  Flavors are largely the same, again extremely roasted and toasty, with loads of dry cocoa, coffee, and bread notes (hinting at pumpernickel).  Earthy, grassy hoppiness intensifies the dryness.  This certainly isnt a sweet brown ale, by any means.  The palate is moderate in substance, lively, and nearly bone dry.  I think the bready yeast has gorged itself on whatever sugars this puppy once held.  Its a decent, toasty sort of nut brown, but the extreme dryness isnt my thing in this style.

Im pouring a deep brown ale with an inch of off-white foam, the head smells of freshly baked bread and raisins. Taste is more on the malty side, with an undercurrent of a yeasty sourness which disappears, leaving me to a mild aftertaste of coffee and dark malts, much like a stout. The aftertaste in general, however, is not very present and carries a bit of disappointment on my behalf. Very nice mouthfeel, the palate is silky smooth and the alcohol is present without being out of place. Moreover: very drinkable. Good work by Nøgne Ø, though not quite interesting enough to make me shout the Hallelujahs. Then again, that may actually be their point, according to the label - its supposed to be a good pairing with a variety of foods. Ill definitely buy it again though.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2010 500ml bottle.  Pours a gorgeous slick dark black coffee color with a nice creamy frothy light tan head 4.5.  Aroma has some nice roast, light acidity, round, smooth fruits, toasty popcorn, much better at room-temp, vinous brown sugar 7.5.  Flavor has some nice roast, round, light acidity, lots of fruit, quite round like a baltic porter, some ash, oily tasting, cola, vinous brown sugar, nutty, ample bitterness, toffee, hides the alcohol nicely 7.5..  Fantastic creamy body with fluffy carbonation, feels fairly dry, again, baltic porter-like.
500ml bottle. Poured a dark brown color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of roast, some dried raisins, chocolate, and nuts. Tastes of chocolate, nuts, caramel, and some roast.

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of roasted malt, nuts, light bitter coffee, and a hint of brown sugar.  Poured brown in color with a small, beige head that disappeared except for around the edges.  Cloudy.  Slightly sparkling.  Flavor is slightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of malt, hops, pine, nuts, and hints of chocolate and caramel.  Medium body.  Average texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, nut, hop, and slight pine finish is slightly sticky.  7.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet.Batch 403.  Pours or more correct, evacuates out of the bottle, body turns out to be hazy dark amber with a big frothy tan head.
Aroma is full of roasted malts, dark fruits, raisins and prunes. Taste is a malt bomb with complex malts all the way, though the bitterness balances this quite good, making the end of this beer turn out on the bitter side. Alcohol bite at the end.

Bottle, 50cl, from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. Batch 403 (BB 15.12.2013). Gusher indeed (lots of spillage even after being stood upright for days). Head settled into a lasting thin layer. Murky dark golden brown colour with orange hue. Rich, alcoholic caramel, fruity (apricot?) and hoppy aroma. Good balance. Medium bodied, but marred by an overly fizzy carbonation. Nice mildly bitter finish.

bottle from ølfabrikken,  batch 461, brwed 161009, bbf 161012
very dark brown, smooth light brown head.
very nice hoppy floral aroma, based in malty sweetness, unfortunaltely also some citrussy or vineagra sourness in there. however the entire aroma experience is very nice, like a joly pumpkin ;-).  aroma is complex.
flavor is slightly flowery sour, caramel, very nice malty sweetness, roasted grains,

Bottle shared by Pinball. Dark brown body with a steady beige head. The aroma is slightly bretty, nuts, brown sugar, malty, caramel and hops. Light roasty, fruity flavour. Notes of nuts, hops, very light brett, light coffee and light dust.. It ends up dry and nutty.

Bottle, batch 403. Explodes out of the bottle, huge gusher this one. More or less half the bottle poured out on the kitchen counter and floor. What actually got into the glass is a dark brown hazy ale with a big tan head. Aroma is familiar NØ. Fresh hops and slightly mineralic, but dominated by liqourice, thick dark caramel and chocolate. Thick with flavour, loads and loads of malt sweetness, but enough hops to balance it out in a semi dry finish. Smooth texture and creamy yet lively carbonation and a medium thick body makes it very drinkable. Sort of an inbetweener this. Not low abv enough to make it a sessioner, and not complex enough to make it a serious sipper. Just a well balanced, good tasting brew that fits well into an evening lineup of lighter and heavier beers.

From notes. Very dark brown. Brown/dark rust edges. Tan carbonation. Dry toasted grains, milk chocolate, ground coffee, graham crackers, nougat, subtle earthy and bitter hops- nice aroma. Flavor adds roasted malt and subtle spice and greens (somewhere between grass and pine) from the hops. Medium/full body, balanced and soft carbonation, very easy to drink for the body. Solid.

Bottle. Bit of a gusher this one, Once it settled down a bit poured a very murky brown with large rocky tan coloured head. Aromas of sweet malt, some chocolate a little dark fruit and pelnty of US hops. Flavours were much the same though per most reviews slightly sweeter then the nose. Quite dry on the finish with plenty of hop bitterness. Nice beer.

500mL bottle from local specialty beer shop.  Pours light red-brown and very cloudy, but the (very!) high carbonation may have contributed to the cloudiness.  Complex aroma consisting of sweet malt, raisins and the distinctive smell of American pale ale style hops, carrying through to the palate with some earthiness, while the sweeter flavours linger along with some bitterness.  This bottle stated 40 IBU rather than the 30 listed for this beer, and the balance at recommended serving temperature is excellent.

Frothy, rocky off white head tops a cloudy, red brown liquid. Raisin, prunes vanilla, kamfer wood on the nose and cloves and cummin seeds adding to the mouth. Lightly bitter and acidic with a n alcoholic finish. Not bad!

Murky, deep brown body, ruby red tinges and persistent light tan head. Chocolate and roasted notes on the aroma then some citrus notes. Smooth taste, chocolate, caramel (light) great body to this, zesty and facewarming

500ml Bottle. A gusher! After settling down this poured dark brown with a big beige head and had an interesting nose. Aromas of pepper, wood, caramel and nuts. Flavour is much the same with a little more sweetness on the palate and less spiciness. Still fairly dry on the finish though. A good beer but I think I drank it too cold.

Brown hazy beer.
Aroma of alcohol, apples, citrus and sausage. A bit acidic.
A flavour of chocolate and apples. Acidic with dry english bitterness.

Pours hazy brown with a huge tan coloured head that leaves chunky lacing. Nose has massess of roasted nuts with caramel toffee malt in support as well as US piney/citrus hops. Palate translates well, some fudgy chocolate adds palate weight before the US hops and elevated abv kicks in, the later a little dominating. Great beer, but the pronounced abv on finish is a bit of a kick in the nuts.

500ml bottle. Batch 403 Brewed 15.12.08 BB 15.12.13...all handwritten!
Slightly murky deep bronze body with decent sized light tan head with excellent persistance and clumpy lace.
Nutty malts on the nose. Hints of chocolate, liquorice, toffee and medium roast coffee. Some citrusy hops in the mix, plenty of grapefruit and grass.
Smooth texture, big lengthy sticky malt body, low carbonation.
Nicely rounded malt body, nuts, toffee, chocolate, with well intergrated hop citrus, bitter orange, grass and a hint of dried fruit. Finishes quite bitter, a hint of roast astrigency. Alcohol slightly apparent on finish.
Very nice brown ale in general. Good mouthfeel, good malt flavour, welcome hops, finish is probably the only thing I can fault.
Red brown colour big head pink tinge medium carbonation aroma spice caramel dark fruit flavour caramel hop bitter honey coffee hint of mushroom earthyness finish malty okay bitter tasted better

Bottled, vintage 2006, sampled 2009. A polished chestnut red-brown beer with a brown head. The aroma is sweet with nuts hitting you at first, then comes notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, and brown sugar. The flavor is sweet malty with strong notes of caramel, nuts, and brown sugar, with aged vinous notes, probably due to it being 3 years old, and some roasted malt notes. The mouthfeel is very smooth with a medium carbonation, and leading to a dry and slighlty bitter finish, where some roasted notes of caramel and nuts lingers.

(Bottle, new batch, on 2009-02-17) Dark brown and hazy. Medium sized white head. Malts, nuts and molasses in aroma. Full bodied and dryish palate with medium carbonation. Malts, nuts, bitterness, sweetness, molasses in taste. Lightly roasty and somewhat bitter aftertaste.

This one was brewed in 2006 although i bought it 2009-02-13!

Apperance: Dark brown with a very generous head and lots of lacing.

Aroma: Chocolate, Roasted malts, Caramel, Fudge, Raisin.

Flavor: Raisin, Chocolate, Fudge, Milk chocolate, Caffe latte, Hint of port wine.

A bit too sweet but quite nice to sip at during an hour. Try it with either chocolate or cheese because it pairs well with both. An interesting beer.
Bottle. Dark red brown body. Small beige head. Heavy sweet malty aroma. Heavy sweet flavour, hints of coffee. some sweet alcohol flavour. (At home, 29.09.08)

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2010 Bottle. Beautiful red/brown colour. Beige head. Aroma of barley, hops and chocolate. Tastes like an american barley wine with lots of chocolate. Feels like milk in the mouth. The beer is overall a little too mild and smooth. It´s not complex enough... although this is obviously a very good beer.

Brown color with a beige head. Aroma: Malty, sweet and lightly roasted, chocolate, caramel, licorice, nuts and citrus. Flavor: Malty and sweet, with american hops in the background, lightly roasted, caramel, chocolate, citrus and nuts. Smooth and well balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2008 Brown color with a beige head. Aroma: Malty, sweet and lightly roasted, chocolate, caramel, licorice, nuts and citrus. Flavor: Malty and sweet, with american hops in the background, lightly roasted, caramel, chocolate, citrus and nuts. Smooth and well balanced. A very nice American Brown Ale.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Aroma is malty and caramellish. Taste is a bit roasted malt with some nice toffee and caramel notes. Incredible smooth!

Botella. Deep dark brown colour with a big creamy light brown head leaving a very nice sticky lacing. Aroma of roasted malt and caramel, chocolate and some dark fruits. Very good filling mouthfeel. The flavour is soft with with caramel, roasted malt, some chocolate, dark fruits, little spice and coffee. Tasty brew indeed!

Dark brown with huge light brown head. Aroma has roasted malt, caramel and overripe fruits. Sweet flavor with roasted malt, caramel and chocolate notes. Hints of coffee and hops leading to a solid bitter end.

Bottle. Pours a brownish colour with an off-white head. Aroma is malty with notes of fudge and some dried fruits. Flavour is quite sweet and very malty with notes of dried fruits, chocolate, fudge and some cooked vegetables.

Sampled at BDRs tasting and shared by akevitt. Pours a semi-clear dark brown brew with a good sized beige head that has some nice retention and spotty lacing. Aroma of roasted dark malts, some chocolate, licorice, and a touch of dark pitted fruit and citrus zest. Taste is medium bodied, light carbonated with flavors of roasted dark malts, dark pitted fruits, and a touch of dried yeast. Finish is semi-sweet with a mild chocolate and roasted dark malt after taste.

A dark clear brown ale with a thick moka head, well carbonated. Interesting aroma of chocolate and leather, very animal. In mouth, a wallop of a brown ale, with bitter chocolate, coffee, caramel malts, grapefruits, licorice, with a rich oily mouth feel. Like eating 90% cooking chocolate. Bieropholie import, BB 12-03-09

50 cl bottle. Ordered a box about 12 bottles of this wonderful beer, shared with a good friend and my father.

This beer has a wonderful mouth-feel and a aroma from hell. No kidding here! This is one of the best beers you can enjoy from the nordic countries. Well then, to the taste, very much butterscotch and fudge in the taste with a slightly bitter nose. Excellent!

Thanks to akevitt for sharing.  Bottle, batch #237.  Pours a clear red-brown body with light brown head.  Aroma of malts, vanilla, yeast, and a touch of hops.  Flavor is mostly caramel malts with a slight hint of grapefruit.  Slightly oily mouthfeel and medium bodied.  Well-balanced and enjoyable.

[Bottle, thanks for sharing Akevitt!] Pours cloudy light brown with a small cream head. Aroma has a lot of caramel malt and wheat with a good deal of fruitiness too. The taste is big on malt, but there is also a lot of good citrusy flavors and bitterness from the hops. Wheat is once again present, as is some fruitiness (non-citrus) from the yeast. Medium-thick mouthfeel with a long toasted malt finish. Really quite a nice beer.

Roasted malt and vanilla aroma.  Brown, opaque.  Lacing head.  Loads of malt, a little sweet, lightly toasted, hint of fruity hips but very little of it.  Great heavy palate.  Great stuff.  Thanks to Akevitt for sharing this one.
Many thanks to akevitt for this tasting.  Amber color with foamy brown head.  Light caramel with some dark pitted fruits on the nose.  Hoppy creamy body with more caramel spice.

Bottled. Murky reddish brown colour with beigeish brown head. Leaves nice lace. Aroma is a lot of caramel, raisins, some licorice and spices. Flavour is very much the same with wood and freshly cut grass added. The alcohol gives a slight sweet touch to it.
